Works great most of the time.  On occasion the GPS doesn't track and I get done with a run to find my distance was zero.  Not sure if that is an app or phone service issue though.
Time management. It was pretty nice how it tells you how far you ran, without checking every minute.
Map my run I've used this app for a couple years. It's never frozen or skipped on me.  Seems accurate,
PERFECT when I want to keep how many miles I'm putting in running,  or biking this is the app a use. It's also motivation when I see my friends putting in more miles than me!
I love it love the live tracking feature.  even though I don't require it.  I think it's amazing!   great app
My Workout Mom! Gives me variety of workout types and flexibility of workout integration. The gps facility has improved lately. No missed workouts.

Flawless It's Simple & easy to use, and the "challenges" help inspire me to work out! Have had no issues nor bugs. I had to switch phones and signing in kept track of all my work outs seamlessly. I have the free version and haven't purchased anything (not even sure if that's an option) and everything works flawlessly.
Only works half the time Works fine sometimes, but frequently (running same route) it tracks time and shows the route but misreports the kilometres.
Its awesome. But dont go pro. Really helpful!!!!! Keeps u motivated. Although going pro doesn't add anything new to this app. So stick to the free version. And it keeps crashing every now and then.

Great app for tracking activity Great for tracking my parkruns. Helps maintain motivation. I run on an old smartphone so I don't worry too much about rain or mud! Would like it to auto start my music when I start an activity. #LittleStokePark #NoSurrender

Marathon here I come! In the past year I have dropped 100 lbs using clean eating by calories & macro balance on MyFitnessPal and running and exercise tracking on MapMyFitness. I run my 2nd marathon in a few days and feel great!  Thanks for helping a middle-aged, obese male feel like his twenties again!

Tried it The map (gps) portion did not work.  It left off 2/3 of the walk.  We walked about 3 miles and it only log 0.9 miles with a different route.  Not sure what to use it for if your figures are inaccurate.

Good for mapping but you have to stop and select each activity type as you go which makes it a bit cumbersome when running then walking on the same route. Going to try this out a bit longer before deciding if I'll switch back to Fit.
Awesome Great app! Any way you can update to add P90X3 & Focus T25 or Body Beast?

Underarmour  is lit I've used alot of fitness apps and by far under Armour app is the top go to pick for me it's intuitive and super easy to use and it calls out your milage and pace which is genius since you don't need to stop and manually check I highly recommend this product to anyone who hikes,walks,freeruns,and runners my one and only gripe about this app is that it scares you when it calls out your data other than that it's amazing

A very well-rounded app I use a Samsung Galaxy Note 4.  It tracks you very well in the way that it indicates.  The food / nutritional section is not user-friendly. You try to be pacific as possible with food descriptions/vendors and it gives you something that you didn't describe so you try again and sometimes again ... frustrating. I gave up on it. It could have some other tools that you use and don't  have to pay for.   I would hate to buy this app and have other disappointments. But overall the apps not bad.

Just an update from my last review below. Walgreens will no longer link to MapMyFitness. I think the MMF app is great. You can check out your history for over a year and you get weekly, monthly, and annual updates as well as occasional "fitness flashbacks" for special achievements, all with the free app. I do think the workout types available have been reduced. Just lately I've been having difficulty with the app pausing and restarting in the middle of a walk. I'm attempting to uninstall and reinstall to see if that helps. Finally, I wish the logout was one easy step from your workout. You have to go back to a menu screen and go all the way to the bottom to find logout. Overall still terrific.  Walgreen's revamped their Balance Rewards for healthy choices and can link with devices and apps, including Map My Fitness that covers everything. I've been using it for over a year and think it's great. They've helped me out when I had problems with the Walgreens sync and I love the weekly feedback. Map just got taken over by Under Armour and I've had problems with the app forgetting my password even after it reset. I just uninstalled.and reinstalled and it was fine but an annoyance.

5 stars for a great application! I use Mapmyride but it's the same thing. I had one problem with it, the GPS wouldn't map me correctly but I asked for help and got it from their service people (who did a great job.) DO NOT use any power saving settings on your phone and it will map perfectly. I love that it keeps me informed while I'm working out so I know how many calories, how far etc. I can't say enough good things and I use it for free. I have this connected to Myfitnesspal and my UP3 health band and it all works pretty seamlessly together.
Great app Easy to use and very helpful app. I gave 4 stars only because it's lack of my favourite roller-blades skating.
Live and breathe by it I've used several over 15 years of being a fitness enthusiast. The connectivity with other apps and services makes this indispensable.

App connection is awful I've been fighting with connecting UP, MapMyFitness, and MyFitnessPal and it's awful. The app can't handle a pop-up that takes it out of focus and retain it's state on resume. So if you have multi-factor authentication enabled for FB, don't expect things to work well for you if that's the claim you like to use as your authentication method. Aside from that, it keeps telling me that my info for the other apps is incorrect. I just kept doing out over and over and eventually one worked. Maybe if I keep at it..

Excellent, the only app you'll need for all your workouts This has been a great app. I like it because I do wide range of exercises and sports, and I like it that I can track all of them with one app as well as record my bike routes and running routes via the GPS feature. The auto pause feature makes tracking the actual time moving a breeze. My only request is that they add an option under Activity so one can enter in their own custom options. Sometimes I find it limiting what pre-loaded Activities are available to choose from. Otherwise I'd rate this app 5 stars.
Good when it works It worked great when I first downloaded it but the nutrition side of it stopped working me which is annoying. But other than that very good for keeping track and motivated.

OK but I've had some issues The app in itself is good but I've had various issues from the beginning: (1) I couldn't login via Facebook as it offered because it just kept going back to the login screen (2) It has shut down randomly a few times when I've just started working out (3) It doesn't always communicate with MyFitnessPal as to the correct kilojoule/calorie amount burnt e.g. MapMyFitness says I've burnt 200 calories, but in My Fitness Pal it days a significantly lesser amount has been burnt (this could be issue with MFP though)
Inconsistent I like the app and use it a lot but if I run the same route, the distance can be (isn't always but can be...) off by a fair amount.

Works for me Provides features I need to track distance, pace, and variety of workout formats. It may have ability to give me course directions on the go when I want to run or bike a predetermined route, but I haven't figured out how to do that yet.
Excellent Great app easy connection to other apps & fitness trackers easy loading...no complaints as of yet.
Great way to track your fitness. Great app to track and share your fitness activity. Good way to challenge and motivate friends to get active.
Inaccurate I walked 4.4 miles and 56 mins and the app said I did 1.2 miles and 25 mins,linked it to Bounts to earn points,obviously they don't want to give out to many
My new trainer MapMyFitness is a great way to keep up with what you are doing and help you push yourself harder.
No issues with Mapping or Logging of my walk on this occasion (1st time using this app). I'll give it a month and add more comments. But 5 star for now.

Mapping My Fitness Great Fitness App which is a good aid for gauging your fitness progression. App has been malfunctioning by not letting me see activity feed or suggested friends, Im uninstalling then reinstalling

Simply awesome, This app helps me track my activities like none other I've tried before, connectivity is the key for me,  I love it!   updated version is even better! Using it over a year now and I love it still just as much!

Accurate and easy to use Have used this app for a long time and think it is excellent.  Love how it syncs with my Jawbone Up 3.

Having some trouble I lost a lot of time and effort because at least one (I'm hoping not more) recipe suddenly went back to only providing only a link to the website where I had originally gotten it.  I had made tons of changes and added notes to the recipe from the various times I had made it, and wanted my husband to be able to make it from my recipe this morning.  But I had to sit down there with him and use the website to try to jog my memory and tell him what to do.  I rely heavily on this app. What has happened?

Getting better (7th May) This app is going back in the right direction again. Scaling works at last making it a breeze to do the groceries and more importantly buying only the amount you use which saves you a bundle in unwasted food. Overall aesthetic design is still garish and really could be improved but I recommend this app for anyone who wants to be in control of their larder and fridge; store and create recipies that are scalable (make batches and freeze for a home cooked weekday meal, every day) Share with your family too!

Its good, the first one of three that I downloaded today to see what would work. This seems good but again...NO ABILITY TO SCAN A RECIPE! Why is this not a functionality??????????? I don't want to spend time writing up a recipe I may see in a magazine somewhere...seems so dumb that nobody does this.
Pretty good It's pretty useful. I just wish there was a nutritional information section but I just put it into the notes section
Very handy Sometimes difficult to adjust ingredients on the mobile version (always seem to end up with too many #'s), but overall useful and easy to use once you work out some of the quirks.

Great app. Not crazy about new layout I love the app! I love the additions and upgrades, but not the new appearance. I don't like the theme, or the thick colored frames around each recipe in the list. would love to see larger thumbnails of recipes in list view. The recipe photo is too stretched out. I would enjoy it more if photos were more prominent. It would be cool if extra photos could be added for steps.  I would also love it if after importing a recipe, there was a pop-up that gives an option of going to that recipe to view and edit.
Best I've found Had problems logging in . Once I ignored that found it to be a fantastic program. Very adaptable.

Spent half a day looking for the perfect Meal Planner App, and thought I'd struck gold.   Um...no.  It's no better than an Excel spreadsheet since you have to do all the work yourself, AND it's glitchy. Even on the sites it allows imports from, the measurements were ALWAYS off, and I'd have to go in and manually fix all of them before saving.  Also sucks that for the Meal Planner you can only add recipes (that you've created yourself, OR imported), and not any of the items I spent hours stocking my pantry with.  The 'HELP' page leads to nothing, and I could find NO assistance anywhere and had to spend hours just figuring out stuff for myself, so have moved back to my old app.  This app has SO MUCH potential, but unfortunately it's not supported like it should be, help pages don't work, and there's no guidance; you just have to figure it out. Well, instead of spending anymore time on it (I think I put in 12 hours), my "guidance" tells me to just use something else.  If this ever works like it's supposed to, I'll be back because the idea behind it is great.

Absolutely disappointed with the latest update. The buttons in grocery list are too small.  It takes at least 5 attempts to tap on any of them to work.  I use a 10" tablet and they're still so small.   Also, I've created several custom categories and they can't be sorted, so they look like they're all over the place.
Very helpful! I love that I can share the grocery list w/my husband. Also adding recipes from favorite sites is super easy. It's just what I needed.

Pinterest update? I love this app. Just wondering if there could be a way to link my Pins to the weekly recipe planner instead of bringing recipes in from Pinterest. It just seems like double the work.

I've used this site for almost 5 years now.  The recipes are awesome.....I found the old style (set up) more user friendly.  The new one has deterred me from using the app as frequently due to difficulty in finding what I am looking for.

Mark Knapp It's a great app. But when scrolling the recipes. When leaving a recipe to continue on. It sends you back to the very beginning. Instead of letting you continue on where you left off. Not good. But other than that. A very good app. Lots of great ideas. Cheers
Nutritional Info? Why do I have to pay for nutritional info? I can get plenty of other recipe apps for free that have the nutritional info. Installing and also unsubscribing from your emails now.

:( Okay I like the idea, but why can't we see the saved recipes offline? What if I want to make something, but there's no internet connection? should I just wait for the connection to come back to make lunch for my family? I hope you can consider this.

What's up with all the "1 serving" recipes? I guess we're just supposed to ignore the stated serving size. It is annoying even when accurate, but often obviously wrong. Just browsing randomly, I have only come across "1 serving" and "24 serving" recipes, neither of which are useful to me (if true).  I gave this app a shot because allthecooks recently imploded.

The app is a little cumbersome to navigate but still a great app.  Suggestions: 1. the ability to set your homepage like you can on the Web version so you don't have to navigate through 4 pages to get to one of your recipes.  2. Off-line access to recipes in our folders is an absolute must,  especially if we are paying for pro membership.

This gets three stars because of a terrible oversight in their UI, I want to see my recipes first.  If I took the time to type it in, I want it prioritized over everything else.  But for some reason, I have to go digging every time.  It's extremely annoying.    The grocery and menu planning are great, once you can finally get to the recipes you want.  I don't even know why they have your favorite recipes when they insist on showing you everything but.    For a paid service this is unacceptable.

Redesign Please The app is great in theory but not always in practice. First  a material redesign would be nice. The app as it is now is sort of ugly and feels clunky. The website and the app don't seem to communicate together very well at times. That being said I like the app for meal planning and creating shopping lists. Overall, I feel everything could be executed much better.
Additional things You should add high calories to diet and be able to see how much calories in each meal
Too expensive All interesting aspects of this app come at a hefty price. Want to download your own recipe? Cool but it'll cost you a dollar, per recipe...
Convenient I use this app often. It is very convenient when I'm out of ideas for dinner. I do wish there was an "edit" option for the reviews.
This is the best app. You can use it for quick recipe or you can get very in depth with your meal planning. I just hope they don't mess it up with future updates.

Frustrated  and furious I can not add to my folder. I went to help site and watched the help video which would have been helpful if it was the same as my app. Tried to get in touch with help desk. Now it does not recognize my password and does not send me an email to reset. All went wrong when i paid for premium! It would be wonderful if it worked!!!! Hope to goodness I can get my money back!!!!!!

Great for all levels of experience!! I absolutely love this app, lately been having an issue with search feature. Error pops up saying error communicating with bigoven and then crashes.  Will give five stars when fixed.

Horrible app If all you want to do is drag and drop their recipes or clip from Web and use that as a menu planner and grocery list it will be good,  but if you're looking for something to build you're own recipes or build grocery list not from recipes it is cumbersome and annoying. Interface jumps from flashy recipes mode to droning "linked to big oven webserver" mode. Unable to upload pictures for your own recipes from Android phone (you have to go to computer). Stupid,  I have not owned a Windows computer in 10 years! Any cook worth their salt has recipes or modifies the ones they get and they build shopping lists a lot. This app is not for you.  Uninstalling.

I depend on this app! I am in love with BigOven! It has changed the way I meal plan, shop, and cook...for the better! It makes cooking at home so much easier for me. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because it occasionally is buggy and slow. And that makes it hard when I depend on it so much, and I use it every day.

Great service app is laggy requires internet The service is great but the app needs more work.  Biggest complaint is that adding to or viewing the grocery list is sluggish. Also, if you have spotty internet access the app will not work well.  The app doesn't render the list and sync in the background like most To Do lists.  If you have poor connectivity and bring up the app in the grocery store it doesn't work well or sometimes even at all.

I LOVE BigOven!!!!!!!!!  It makes cooking so much easier.  I use it multiple times a day.  It's hard to pick my favorite part of it because it makes so many things easier - from choosing a recipe amongst their huge collection or your own private recipes (best search features ever allowing me to use up ingredients, avoid ingredients, etc.) ... to creating a menu plan that keeps me get and stay organized for the week ... to making a grocery list that's easy to use at the store (and easy to change/edit - how often does that need to be done, right?).  It's easy to use, and the customer service has always been phenomenal whenever I've had a question or suggestion.   There are so many little features that you can use if and only when you want to, that make it amazing.

Luv it and use it often but I don't have the PRO version and for some reason I used to be able to share recipes and post pictures but can't anymore, why is that? I would luv to upgrade to PRO but $20/mth is way to expensive
Love Big Oven Great app. Have enjoyed several recipes. Its so easy to use.

Great app I love being able to set up menus, including my own recipes, and generate a shopping list. There are also many recipes to look up and try out. My one complaint is in moving between devices my shopping cart items often get lost. I haven't found anyone else who has recipes that can be put in a meal planner then added to a shopping list.
Big Oven Great app, only reason I won't rate as 5 stars is the app often refers to external source links for recipe directions. It is a bit of a hassle, but the app is still well worth the download!

Best cookbook as long as you have the space for it. I can find everything from south-style greens to homemade ice cream to just plain old hamburgers in 4 different cooking styles: grilled, baked, stovetop, and forgot the other. I have An older phone so sadly it doesn't have enough space for it until I get a new one. It's a kind of big app. Also, I don't even use the premium feature as usually I can find the recipe through search. Awesome find.

Always something new. This is the only recipe app. I've kept. Whenever I log on to this app there's always fresh new ideas. The editors pick its awesome and there's many different ways of doing the same old food. I'm very pleased with the amount of recipes on here. I also never see the recipes repeated and I love the to try. And the save this button. Thanks for a great app.
More.. Love it because it gives lots of different ways you can make almost anything with.. love looking on here for new things to try and things I've never even seen or heard about..

It has it all, even if you don't go pro It's easy to use, it has all I need to organize my week, and that was even before I went pro. It is just great. One small annoying thing though is I have to logoff and back in every time to have my pro no ads version, I wish they fixed that!
Love it Love the extensive recipes, and so many different cultural recipes as well. Haven't cooked a single bad recipe yet.

Thinking about Subscription I love this app. Recently discovered it, but have used it more than any. Tried several recipes and liked them all. I am disappointed that I can only do certain tasks if I subscribe ( I am a broke student). However, if I continue to enjoy the app...subscribing  is my next step.

Nice app.  I found some very good recipes with this.   And the amount of recipes available is second to none. I love the user added photos also.  Only one question.   Is their a way to move recipes around to other folders after you have tried them? Or delete them from your folders if you no longer want them?

Lots of Recipes Plenty of easy to follow recipes with a shopping list generator.  What could be simpler. Would have been 5 stars if dev hadn't taken the app offline the second time I tried to use it, use a backup server while running upgrades!
Use it alot I find some really good recipes on this app. I use it quite a bit.

Not letting me access favourite recipes I save recipes to the "to try" option but then it doesn't let me view them it states that there is a communication problem to BigOven despite a perfect connection to my internet, a very useful app with this problem being its only downfall

Catalogue all your online recipes This is a great app for saving recipes off of the internet and cataloging them. It does really well at recording just the relevant parts of the webpage and assembling them as a recipe with the ingredients, method etc. The only addition to the app I wish to see is the ability to take photos of recipes and provide optical character recognition to record the text from magazines and books. Extremely Useful I love this app. It stores and organizes  recipes easily from any website or blog. I use it frequently. ***When I needed to email Support with a question, they were wonderfully helpful!

I love this app! Works great on my Galaxy Tab S & on my Droid Turbo. This is the best recipe app around! I have the pro paid version which is totally worth the price for the quality of this app & ability to save unlimited recipes. I've got thousands of saved recipes on sites all over the net, but I've made sure to save them on this app too because it's easier to access them. Recipes can be organized however you like by category, & put into a "make" category temporarily which is super useful. Being able to clip from any site on the net is great, now I've got a place with all my recipes organized just as I like. The new shopping list component is useful too as the app syncs easily from my tablet to my phone. I've never written a long review of an app before, but I just love Cheftap. Hope they stay in business!

Best with 1 suggestion. I've tried a lot of these apps, including the pay apps and this one is by far the best in my opinion.  It's the easiest to move recipes to from Evernote, books,  and websites. I love that you aren't limited to what sites you use because I follow a lot of blogs. The only thing I would like to see (that no other app has either) is the ability to import recipes from pdf cook books.

Accurate Clipping with Good Fallbacks Not only does it scrape recipes well, but it makes it very easy to correct details or modify a recipe after the fact. The newer Shop feature is very good, and incredibly convenient
Finally!! Shopping list! The best. No other app does this! It's amazing! Worth the price of a subscription, easily.

Finally! Love this app due to the simplicity and functionality. I send all of my recipes here, even if I'm in another food/recipe app. I can edit the steps, add comments for next time, add pics, and add the items for a recipe to a shopping list to buy later. Also makes it so much easier to file my recipes. Definitely recommend!

Thumbs Up!!! So far I deleted all of my other weight loss apps and find this app the best. Very organized accurate and motivating.

Ad placement on new update I know you guys need to make your money and I've been using your app since WAY back when you guys first came out and have enjoyed this app immensely, but your ad placement is getting out of hand. Placing an ad on the top of the log page is SO annoying and highly distracting. It also seems to re-load at a pretty constant rate which leads me to think it's using my data unnecessarily. Be creative with your ad placement and not look like you only care about us a revenue source.

Ads / overpriced subscription I've been a user of this app for a long time. I understand the need to monetize, but it's starting to get a bit out of hand. Premium is too expensive, and now there are ads cluttering up the UI. Not a good move.
Great app! It took a little getting used to, but once you get the hang of it this is a great app! It is easy to use & a very effective weight loss tool. I'm already down 29 lbs.

My favorite health app!  It has been very useful to me and my health goals.  I love that you can make recipes that combines ingredients and divides it into servings, helping out the home-cook!  It has an extensive database, part of which is crowd-sourced.  Crowd-sourcing does have its downfalls (sometimes items are inaccurate), but this app compensates by allowing you to edit food details, for instance, after scanning a barcode.  Sometimes it lacks restaurant items, but you can enter a custom item (such as something you looked up on google) and that is good enough for me.  The custom options really make the app!  Besides those benefits, this is the one app I love updating.  The team actually writes what is being improved in the "what's new" section, making it seem like someone actually cares and is working on real problems.  The developers seem to actually listen to complaints and FIX the problems!  Keep up the good work guys!

Better than MFP I definitely find the UI and UX better than MFP. Easier to use, more intuitive, better looking, less obtrusive ads and sponsored content. Only thing missing is Garmin connect communication! Definitely bump up to 5 stars with that functionality.

Great App Love this app. Downloaded after reading bad reviews about weight watchers. It is easy to use and lots of great features. My favorite is the barcode scanner. It makes it easy to add the calories onto my daily log. I also love that I could link my activity tracker to the app. It adds my calories earned from exercise. So great. Download it, you won't regret it. I am thinking that I might purchase the premium app based on how great the free version is.

After 3 attempts to resolve the problem...linking with Google Fit "breaks" the app.  You lose the ability to scan or manually search for foods to enter and the app locks up.  The developers are aware of this, but my last email response stated that they hadn't identified the "glitch" so they can't estimate when it will be resolved and to keep an eye on updates in the Google Play store.  As a paid subscriber that only paid for the sync ability, I'm not happy.  They extended my membership 2 months as compensation, but that was 2 months ago and the app is still not working.  If I have to use an app that won't sync with Google Fit I might as well go back to MyNetDiary since it has far superior Diabetes tracking and reporting.

Good app This app kept me accountable for my 30-lb weight loss, and continues to be the best thing I have done for my health. I like the layout and ease of use, and as a result, I've never lost motivation to log my food everyday.

Love it! This app really keeps you on track.. It's super easy to use and when I do follow it.. I Lose weight! I have recommended it to several friends! I think there are a few minor bugs with sending friend invites and I wish you were able to post pictures in the comment field . especially for the challenges. . All in all.... GREAT APP!

Could be better for android Easy to use food tracker, but doesn't sync with samsung gear, so it doesn't recognize my steps.  Food calorie counts with Android seem off in many cases. Worked much better with my IPhone.

Excellent program After I found how to work with its unfriendly interface I was amazed how powerful is it. There are complete list of foods and dishes including international. Thank you for this awesome software!!!
Love the interface! I used to track calories with MyFitnessPal, but I found the interface on that app cumbersome and difficult to use. I really like the interface on Lose It!
Good app, bad localization for Android. This app is rather intelligent, but fails 3/4 times to let me search up my entries on strong 50 MB WiFi. Please fix.
My last diet i used my fitness pal. These are the best 2 apps for diet control and i suppose it would be personal preference between the two.

Good but errors I cannot change So having to uninstall. Confused, it asked for my weight etc at the startup, once on the app it's telling me I weigh 13kg that's TWO stone so I need to eat 3000 calories a day. I entered the correct weight, it won't let me change it or I can't find an option to do so in all of the settings. If that part was cleared up then sure it seems like a great app with the pie charts and calorie search/goals etc
Buggy This is extremely buggy.  Search doesn't work.  Can't pull up right foods. Repetitive foods and many have different calorie counts.

Love it! I cannot say enough good things about Lose it. I recommend it (highly) to anyone who wants to safely lose weight at a healthy rate. Even the "free" app is pretty darn good if you ask me. Much better than other weight loss/activity tracking apps I have tried. Thanks Lose it!
Keep track and lose as much as you want Love this, I've done well with this app. Gonna go strong again!

Not quite as user friendly as other aps I've been using Noom for about a year,  and functionality of the two aps are nearly identical. I tried LoseIt as it works with the Microsoft Band 2. However, LoseIt is a far chunkier UI (compared to Noom) and it's food item search is intolerably slow,  both with on line wifi and offline. On the plus side,  it's recipes are better, and it's integration with the Microsoft health service strong.

Half done I dont need to lose weight i need to gain it i like the food tracking portion of this app but unfortunately it isnt geared towards my health goals of gaining weight hopefully you guys consider not everyone is over weight some people are on the opposite side of the spectrum

Works for me! But... This app has been useful to me for two years+ in logging food. However...now less user-friendly, more complicated to enter foods and barcode button located too close to other feature. Using Android on phone.

Incorrect information Has nice some features. Soon as I downloaded I scanned several items in my kitchen...unfortunately it was incorrect on the calories on several items, and not by a small amount. Being several hundred calories off in a diet app makes it hard to trust.

Great! I love that you can use the barcode to log calories....what I would love to tweak, would be logging excersise calories burned, because there is a differnce in your number to what I abctually burn. I would love it if you were able to change the number and allow you to type in notes like cardio trainer app. I went from a 4 star to a 3 star due to me switching from a fitbit to a Garmin Vivofit HR and lose it does not sync with Garmin products, super dissapointing.

Great App but it's frustratingly slow at times I switched from Myfitnesspal app to this. I like it overall but when searching the food database, I find it to be way too slow. There should be an option to download the food database to the app and for it to update the cached database automatically. This would speed up searches greatly and I believe fix my issues.

Not accurate always Sometimes when I log food it doesn't add it to my daily total and says I have eaten less calories than I have. For example yesterday it only counted my breakfast even though I logged lunch and dinner and snacks
Great app!!!! I lost some weight with this but i ended up regainingit all back when i uninstalled it
Easy etc.  Wish they hadn't gone with prime paid features though.
Samsung Gear Will Lose It ever be able to sync with the Samsung Gear? That's is the activity tracker I use. And it would be great if I could use 1 app.
Plz i want the full apps make it free i mean the options of pro the fre version is just a joke plz i give u 5star to improve it just a little bit like pro thx alot
Great Best app like this out there! Really easy to use and very helpful.
Won't let me upgrade I've been trying to upgrade to.premium however all it does is say loading...foreverrr. I sat there 30mins with it saying loading. Closed out restarted same thing.
Love the app,  want to upgrade and it just says "loading" forever!
love it, this app has helped me tremendously on how to eat in portions.

Lost 45lbs so far Information is power and "Lose It" gives you power to make weight loss easier. Thousands of items are already in their database waiting for you to pull up and log in(or enter custom foods) Set a weight loss target and Lose it will give you a daily calorie budget to meet that goal. Enter your calories burned off by exercise and get credit to eat more (or not and lose faster). Buy the premium upgrade and link your favored exercise tracking device and "Lose It" will automatically update your calories burned.

New update Not a fan of the new update. I've been using the app for 4 years now and found it easily accessible . You could pull it out and quickly log your meal in before anybody saw you. (I didn't like my friends knowing that I worried about my weight). Since the update, the app tends to lag and it takes longer to log in. I love the app and hope they address the issue.
Too big widthwise for device, no way to add what I'm eating to log.
Good Stuff Super easy to navigate with a huge database of foods to choose from. Also, whoever types the script for "What's New" in the Play Store is absolutely hilarious.

Loved it until... Loved the app until I realized it does not do the math correctly on portions/servings.  If you only eat 1/2 a serving, it still counts the entire serving for your totals!  I cant sit here and enter every food 10 different times with different serving sizes.  Not worth the effort.

Nice app! I like this app ... easy to use and personalize. The only thing I would suggest is that there should be subtotals for each meal ... for protein, carbs and fat.  Each meal should be balanced, not just the whole day.

So far it looks great! I just installed this morning and the third time I opened, it asked me to rate. I haven't had enough time to give a useful review. I did start tracking my food today and it was very easy. I'm looking forward to using this app more as well as exploring the site from my desktop. Maybe a few days into using the app would be a better length of time before asking for a review. On the negative side, I haven't found a way to log out. I don't want to constantly be logged into any app.

Exactly what I needed I've never given a written review on any of the many many apps I've used over the years, but this one is so perfect I had to say something. Everything I need for daily nutrition tracking.

Worthless as an app. Waste of time. Buggy. Useless in most fuctionality. Socializing is impossible as you can't add or even find your friends using the app or on the site . Most of the sites working functions can be found on other apps without the the load of adds and mediocrity. Bottom line I would not recommend spark people to anyone as it is completely unsatisfactory as anything more than a calorie checker with added useless features that do not work.

Best app I have ever used This app is very easy to get around. It not only helps me count calories but also let's me watch my salt and fat intake. I have tried other apps with failure. I plan on staying for a while. I am a cardiac patient and nutrition and exercise  has become a big part of my life. Thank you!

I've tried a lot of calorie counting apps and sparkpeople's food directory is by far the best one out there. It's really easy to scan foods, find what you're looking for, and add a food item that's not already there. Very thorough and user friendly even if you've never used this kind of app before! Sparkpoints motivate you

Was working great until last update App was working well until the last update.  Now does nothing when you try to log info, for both food and exercise.  Tried Uninstaller,  then reinstall.  Same problems.  Too bad,  this was a great app,  linked with fitbit,  good tips,  etc.
I have only just started using it today but it seems pretty good so far... Haven't found anything wrong yet :)
It would be good if you could search something and the nutritional fact come from the company instead of having to add. Everyone facts different.
Great app I love the fact that you can scan bar code of your favourite food and add to your tracker. All the info is automatically entered.  Brilliant!
Spark People Helps in every way. Went from 200 to 173.7 this evening.  I am just beginning to get good at this.

Love hate I love the way it counts everything, but how do I go back and view yesterdays info? Last weeks? Shoot, halfway through the day it looses everything I've put it. Its also upsetting that it has suggested daily values... but suggested off what? Im on a ketogenic diet, why is it saying I should get up to 300 carbs a day? And of course that means fat and protein are off as well.
So far I dig it I wish it had a larger excercise database,but overall it's good.
Everything I need It's so easy to log everything, food, exercise, weight, and everything else you might want.
Great App I love it, the app is easy to use and very intuitive. I love the barcode scan, it helps me avoid having to enter my food manually.
Love it Sparkpeople is an excellent community and the app is improving all the time. Easy to use and have never had a problem with it.
Incredible motivation tool for losing weight This is the most useful app I have ever found to help me be accountable for what I consume.
Its amazing Keeps me motivated. Makes me want to go out and exercise and even eat some new healthy foods!! The community is amazing!
Has almost everything But it's a little buggy on my phone. Otherwise I love it .
Good app Calculates daily intake of food and  what's required depending on weight, age, etc
Love it This app has really helped me stick to a new eating habit.
Total Accountability I  love how you track everything according to your goals.
Interesting I think I found motivation.  This app is pretty fun with the points and chat.
More choices for exercise and foods than other apps. Easy to use!
Good app I'm trying not to be fat. This app helps me be less fat.
Excellent I've been a Sparkpeople member for longer than I care to remember and this app makes tracking food and exercise so easy I have no excuse. I'm very happy with the way this works!
Helpful app The app is pretty easy to use, like the chat and blogs.

Great app for accountability Using this app alongside the Tracy Anderson dynamic eating plan and metamorphosis program is helping me get awareness of calories and activity. Great and easy way to become more health aware.
Great database and I love the positive vibes it gives. Not the easiest to navigate through, but you will get it eventually. Really nice app

Huge Database Love the huge database of food. I can easily search and add foods. The calculator keeps track of my calories for me. Navigation takes just a little while to get used to but otherwise an awesome app. Well worth it!!
I love SparkPeople I would totally recommend this to anyone looking motivation for losing weight and getting fit.
Great This is a great app to track the amount of calorie intake and the amount burned
Easy to navigate and use Great reference tools and tracker for life changes

Takes some figuring out Journaling and recording food and exercise is easy. But creating and figuring out recipes is not. If I make a hot dish for my family and add 1 lbs hamburger, some rice, tomato's, ect...it is not easy to figure out my portion.
so far so good.. one day.. I'll update after using it for a month.
Really love it just wish there was an option to share my stats and achievements with FB. If there is I havent found it yet.
Great app for dieters Like this app, it's great for dieters. Set up your notifications right away or your phone will blow up from all the meal and exercise reminders.
Works Looking for pay app to remove ads. I like the simplicity. Very kewll. Sold.  Now that it is installed, now comes hard part, I know, right?!!

It is fantastic, I love being able to type in what I am eating into the tracker righf ad I am eating. I had tried sparkpeople before but this makes it so much easier to use. Thank you for sparking my health!

Probably my favorite app of all time. I've listened to most of the meditations, even the ones meant for children, and use them to help me sleep. I've had severe insomnia pretty much my entire life, but these meditations can usually ease me to sleep before the recording is even over! Granted, I've listened so often to some of them that I practically have them memorized now. I hope that there will be some new ones in the future, but even if there aren't, this app is a keeper for sure.
Incredibly helpful! This is my go-to when nothing else is helping my anxiety. I use it several times a week and is very helpful in finding my "happy place". :)
Wow This is one of the best if not the best app in its genre and I love it, but I use it everyday

Wow, I'm impressed! This app is really free and really helps. I have been having an unusual amount of anxiety and feeling overwhelmed lately. Then, dealing with my lower back pain is difficult because I am an active person and I can't be as active as I want to. This app helps to remind me to just breathe and every thing will be alright.
Love it It's amazing it is free. Great meditations guided by a lovely voice. Thanks a lot.

Great for kids We have a child who takes hours to settle down to sleep. Using these audios has cut that time down to 30 min and is often asleep by the end of the audio. Lifesaver and my kids looks forward to it every night.
A five star app Easy to follow videos, effective meditation techniques and well written, informative articles to read.  I am delighted to have found this excellent app - thank you developer.

Be Safe...Be Happy...Be At Peace The information in this app is priceless in value. I have a history with CBT & was never any good at achieving results. Then again, I was not aware of the need for continuous trained repetition for successful change. Awesome knowledge and great meditations. The meditations could be longer for experienced mediators though. I find that 10 to 20 minutes is quite short. Love it.

Perfect. Actually literally free. Its so nice to find a free app like this. The voice is soothing, the different meditations are wonderful, and there's so many to choose from. It's really and truly the only app like this that I have found that is any good at all. Highly recommended for anyone looking for guided meditation and relaxation!

Amazing Best relaxation app I've tried (and I've tried the much acclaimed Andrew Johnson ones). This app has so much in it and its so easy to use. I always find it incredibly easy to sleep after listening to one of the relaxation audios, the guided imagery is really nice. Would recommend (and I do) to anyone who wants to experience a deeper relaxation, beginner or not.
Brilliant Peaceful mindful meditative relaxation.
So much information at your fingertips The mindfulness audios I have used with my kids and I use the Qui Gong links almost every day.

Love it! I've had this app on my old phone and when I got a new one I forgot all about it. So pleased I found this again, it really helps me switch off and the audios are so so good. I'm even happier with it now that I've realised it has Qigong videos since I've recently started going to classes.

Great app! Lots of choices and live streams from web site so it doesn't use up my storage! Gets me to sleep peacefully and great for my daughter! Love love love this app. Havent been able to find another that comes close.  Would love some new  scenarios though!
Useful, healing, soothing I use this app for meditation and sleep relaxation. There are also some fantastic audios for panic and anxiety. Great variety in sensory meditation. Love. This. App.
No Achievemint? Love your apps! Helpful, lots of info, easy to follow for self improvement. But why no Achievemint sync for this one?
Useful Great variety of audios for relaxation, mindfulness & loving kindness. Supplements my weekly meditation class as i can use it everyday for practice.
Excellent Very good app. Many different audios and videos. Soothing\ relaxing.
It's the best Wonderful variety, different techniques. Great for the whole family, including for labor relaxation!

Amazing I do this with my dog who is very jumpy at night and at night when I started this she has been a lot less jumpy and I can tell a major difference in her sleeping patterns, it has also helped me sleep at night, me and my dogs both have anxiety so it really helps us both.
Awesome I love this app.  Great info on mindfulness,  beautiful guided meditations, lots of great stuff to explore.
It's looking dated now but it does not matter. The content is good and that's what matters.
Fantastic Use this every single night.  Love the new audios since after awhile I could recite what she was saying! Good thing that means I can tap into the memory and use it at other time
Good but... There is no way to prevent the app from continuing to run in the background when you exit or log out. Otherwise good app but deducting 1.5 stars and uninstalling for this reason.

Unnecessary for me Just never bothered with it. I already do yoga and HIIT. The audios are the same as another app by this company so it was just redundant. It works fine just like the others but I really don't need it.
Love it Works great with panic attacks,and so much more....

Amazing Its free and it really does work. I recommend it. The app helps you meditate easier and faster plus it shows you other ways with step to step instructions. With a soothing voice and nice background music . Love love love it.
This site appeals to me. Thank you to the people that have knowledge in and on this site..good for you.

First time listened it played to end was helpful. Then played 6 minutes only.  So streamed played 6 minutes it stopped. Downloaded what I wanted now doesn't play at all. Hopeless. Information tells me there's 24 or so minutes but won't play. Downloaded all mindfulness.  Hopeless. Have u got suggestions
Best for me I use it to fall asleep paints beautiful  pictures in my mind

I use this every night to fall asleep. I just downloaded the update and I'm excited to listen to the new meditations. My only negative comment is that I don't care much for the woman's voice; to me it is harsh and the cadence of her voice can occasionally be jarring instead of relaxing (however, I've learned to skip those meditations.)
The best relaxation app ever I have used this app every day for the past two years.
Love this app! My daughter sleeps like a baby! Thank you!
A really good app. I've been using it for quite a while.

First time using meditation of any kind. So far I have yet to stay awake during the music part of the relaxation phase of this app due to the fact it relaxes me just enough to drift off to sleep. My surgical doctor asked me to try this and I love it!!!!!
Helps me relax so that I sleep better at night.
Really  nice I like this app very much it is really  helpful  and nicely  made.
Great app Help a lot to reduce stress of life
Thank you! Thank you for bringing back the children's imagery! My 9 year old will not use any other app!  Love it! Best guided imagery for kids!
Simply great I recommend it to everyone. Change the world by changing yourself.

More options I wish it had more options. Different sounds and longer meditation times. I use a different app for meditation music and I normally do two 3 min sessions. But other than that, I enjoy the app. :) good for people like me who's just starting to meditate

It was better earlier. The sounds stop after two bells or gongs. The app isn't working well.  The concept is good that u work up for longer minutes. Which I had achieved with my last phone.  Here its become worse.  I wish there were more options of the gongs or bells.  Sometimes its jarred.
Use It Daily I've gotten into the habit of using this before bed each night, it gives my mind something to ponder as I go to sleep. I really love this app.

Not helpful Simple tool, concept is fine. However the quotes repeat and are not amazing. The sounds don't work consistently, which annoyingly means the end chine doesn't always work and so you may worry about if time is up.   In the end not a great app.   One nice feature is the alternative day reminder.

Simple Simple app that does what it says. I like how it eases you in and gradually increases the amount of time you meditate for. Sad you have to be reminded to take a moment for yourself but this is the world we live in.
I use this everyday I like the quotes. It helps me to center myself when I go overboard on a certain part of my life. I changed because of this app
Meditation App I judt started so I think its unfair to rate so soon, but so far its good.
A Must Amazing program. It is a must if you are like me and work alot and do not have the ample amount of time to actually sit for extended periods of time. Namaste.
Awesome! I am new to meditation & this is very helpful to me, love the inspirational quotes & the easy step by step progression. Great app!

Simple but effective This meditation app is very pleasant. It also reminds you to do it which is very useful. Two minutes is perfect and it is doable, whereas a longer time might put some people off of trying at all. You can always do more than one session however.
Wonderful A lovely app. Simple words of wisdom, and a gentle reminder When it's been a couple days. Really has helped me find a sense of calm in my busy life.

Meditation made easy! So thankful for this specific meditation app, it gradually helps you build to stronger, deeper practice and is exciting to use. Has become a daily ritual and I love it. Happier, brighter days ahead!
Awesome Meditation App Perfect for those so busy to find the time to meditate.  Really easy todo and the timer is really very helpful.  Highly recommend to those who need peace and quiet.

It's okay I like the quotes and the meditation sounds. However my phone does not register the volume on this app, so I always have to remember to turn the sound up before I open the app. Also, I'm starting to wish it could be longer than three minutes!

Great app! As a newbie to meditation, I find this is a wonderful way to get started at meditation. The app has great images and simple phrases to help clear the mind. I enjoy the meditation bell, too.

Very pleased Have wanted to get back into meditation for a long while and this is making it easy to do so. Only complaint is the bell isn't sounding at the end, but sitting a little longer isn't a bad thing.

Nice intro to meditation If your constantly on the go and find it difficult to meditate for long periods of time. This app is for you. with shorter sessions of meditation you can practice in time that works for you and still get the benefits of mindful meditation
The wisdom I learned by meditating Our mind n thoughts determines our happiness or unhappiness in life. Patience is a important key in life n loving n letting go is a part of all relationships.

Very nice As a parent It is a tough balance between personal happiness and family happiness. Thanks to this wonderful app I can revisit my sits in the zen temple and really feel realizing one self to the maximum. Thank you for this wonderful tool for all of us busy people. Namo Amitabha

Calming This app comes with beautiful words of wisdom to help you focus and calm your mind.  I really like that it has option to turn bell on or off.    Only downside is I wish it was timed at 10 minutes instead of 3 minutes,  for me it just seems a bit short but it's a perfect amount of time for any person with a busy life.  I highly recommend this app to anyone!
Good app The sound settings are a little buggy and I also wish you could change the length of meditation instead of having to move up in levels... but other than that it is a great app.

Enjoying "breaking into" meditation one step at a time. Update: I got a new phone and lost all my data forcing me back to short meditation sessions. Wish there was a backup.  This is helping my new year resolution and bringing me peace in my life.
Good introduction to meditation Good, basic app. Images and words a bit repetitive but it's a start. If 3 minutes isn't enough I just press restart - I don't find that too interruptive.
Very cool app Keeps you at 0 stress level during day. Good time for me is morning/onwakeup & evening/beforebed
Meditate Great I know meditation is simple and can be difficult too. This app really is helping me get started. I like it a lot.
Anxiety relief As a teenager who adjusts the changes on becoming an adult, I recommend the helpful quotations to ease our uncalm minds
Worth it I struggle with bad anxiety and depression. I use this for 3 minutes a day sometimes twice! It really helps to calm the seemingly endless train of thoughts in my head.
Worth it This app is convenient and helps me refocus when I get off track. Even if you don't practice consistently, the mantras are perfect for resetting your thoughts and awareness.
Tranquil Great for a moment of peace in all our busy and distracted lives. So much benefit in one little app. I listen to this every day.

Not a fan of the messages The concept & design are nice, but the messages are nearly all stated in negative terms. Pay attention and you'll see... Everything is "don't" or "not". Today I'm finally installing it because the first words were "Failure is..."  A truly good meditation should be started in positive terms.
Nice meditation Cool app.  Very handy when you feel a little stressed out.
Calming Easy to use.   I've gotten a couple of the  same words of wisdom which is disappointing but only a little and I've switched phones so that's part of the reason.
Great meditation starter I was skeptical of meditation in general but this app has really introduced a meaningful process into my habits.
It's good! Good app, found the sounds a little harsh but you can turn them off so its fine.
New to meditation I am just starting to learn hoe to meditate.  I like how it starts you out slow and adds time as you go.
Awesome app I love this app and have recommended it ot lots of people. The only thing it needs is music of something. I just play the ocean on my sound box.
AMAZING!!! ACTUALLY LEAVES MY MIND FREE OF UGLY THOUGHTS AFTER! MUST TRY IF U HAVE ANXIETY OR BAD THOUGHTS N WORRIES EVERY SECOND!!!
On the money At first I was like this is boring but about 90 seconds in enlightenment strikes and the words can be applied to your life, 5 stars!

Not user-friendly It is simplistic which is why I chose it but it is not interactive. On opening the app there are no instructions on how it will help you, it won't let me change the meditation time from the set 3 minutes and the sound is not consistent. When you do eventually set it all it does is ping a bell. I could do this with my own music myself!
Simple & effective Quite powerful, in my experience. I peaced out on a crowded subway car thanks to this app. I might have even given it 5 stars had the creator not asked for that rating.
Glad it's still here I have had this app for a long time and went through a few phone changes and just didn't get it back on . Tried a few others and nope ...Nothing like this one !

The best Excellent app. Helps with aches and pains, afternoon tiredness, stress, and yes, hangovers. I do it daily or more. There is always time, do it instead of watching TV. I like laying down best. Also great in the bath. A must have.

Wow Ive been so tense lately and its affecting my relationship. Ive just listened to it for the first time and at the end my head was clear. Think I need to do this two or three times a day just untill I feel completely relaxed and clear all my bad thoughts

Great! Great when I need to break out of my office chaos for half an hour.                                                This is not for sleeping as he does snap you out of it with counting but that's why it's for relaxation. It gets you to a good place so you can go face the world again. He has an app for sleep and I quite like it. If you're looking for help sleeping that's the one for you. If you're just trying to take a break and then get right back on your feet you will like this.

Phemonenal I thought something scary was gonna happen like a cream but no.... his voice and the music blend so well,this is the therapy everyone needs.I've been having a bad time, all tired and moody (hormones) then I used this. And this is no exaggeration, it has changed my life! I am now more relaxed and controlled and very concentrated!
Awesome Narration Narrator has a very soothing gentle Scottish accent. Great app!
Awesome His voice is rich and relaxing.  The calm music is gentle in the background.  So far the best app for relaxing.

Wow... It works! I suffer from extreme anxiety attacks and  am also coming off of benzodiazepines and the withdrawal sends me in even more anxiety. I had this app on my phone for a while but never used it... Until now. The calm and soothing voice of the speaker along with his instructions sent me to the most relaxed place on the planet.  I've never felt more relaxed while awake. I will start to do this daily... Maybe several times a day.
Brilliant Thanks for this great app. I've now put my boss onto it and it's spreading around the workplace. ..brilliant!

OMG <3 This app is amazing!!! I have a hedgehog and shes SO LOUD at night! But then I put this app on I fall right asleep :D and STAY asleep! This is a life, and sleep saver! I'm going to be a high school student soon and this will help me get a much deeper sleep throughout the year. Thank you sooooo much for giving me my sleep back!!!!! <3
Really helped with my anxiety. I have this overwhelming fear of anaphylaxis, and was having an episode. After listening, I was completely carefree! Such a good thing, natural and easy.

Seems hokey at first.. My mom said I just had to get this app, naturally I rolled my eyes and said it sounded like a crock. She wore me down and finally got me to try it. It was weird at first but after a couple times I became comfortable and it does help me relax.. which is no easy feat

Thank you so much Thank you Andrew for this amazing app. I have had trouble for many years with sleep anxiety. Your app has truly changed my life. After 2 weeks of falling asleep with very little anxiety myself and psyc are considering very slowly reducing my tablets which I am so pleased about. Thank you so much. I look forward to buying ans trying your other apps.

Very good Its a quick, relaxing body scan with a little extra. It totally helped me calm down on an especially stressful and overwelming day. I'm impressed as I've never had something like this work so well on me. Only giving 4 stars because of the end... I wish there was an option to either stay calm OR wake up. The first time I listened, i became tense during the closing part. I was wide awake again and bummed. A+ on his voice!!

great app As I suffer from chronic pain I get little sleep since using this app for relaxing over the last couple of weeks I have found I feel more 'in control' of my life and am beginning to regain my sense of humor. I get a bit more sleep and so am able to deal better with the stress and pain. I enjoy Andrews voice and amazing accent would prefer the counting up to ten to be a bit quiter but that is a minor niggle. Thanks for a wonderful app

Super helpful!   This is really amazing!  At first I thought it would never work and downloaded it for fun and did it in my garden only to realise it really works ans helps so much! This changed my views on things a d made me totally amazed  I use this app now alot and find jt extremely helpful !!  I have also  noticed im more awake and aware in class ans have been getting better grades!  This is just amazing and I would be more than happy to pay for more of Andrew Johnson s apps. Great Meditation tool I started using 'Calm' each morning and I've found that it's a great way to start my day. I haven't meditated a lot and have been reluctant to begin as I was having a hard time finding the value of meditating despite "knowing" it's benefits. By incorporating 'Calm' into my morning practice I've come to experience the benefits of meditation. Each guided meditation focuses on a concept or idea (i.ethe importance of cultivating patience) and discusses why it's important and how it can be carved into daily life

Life changing app! I started using Calm during a particularly stressful time in my life and I have found it invaluable. The guided meditations cover the whole spectrum of emotions, so whether you need a confidence boost or a reminder to have more compassion for yourself and others, there is something for everyone. I especially love the meditation courses offered, having a specific amount of time to set aside each day to complete a course really motivates me to meditate. The deep sleep meditation is great too!

Wonderful app! ('cause I unfortunately not going to pay for a year of calm) but anyway this app is great and it has really added to my meditation practice!  TYSM

I would enjoy this app more if it didnt have a misleading (and in some ways illegal) title, and hope that the makers consider change it.

Epic game You play what you get. There is no form of trading whatsoever so basically you are on your own. At first glance I though this may be unfair but the thing is that as you continue to play you develop a team for different things being Raid, Guild Wars, ToA, PvE and PvP there is not such a thing one size fits all in this game. Every monster contributes to a specific roll that being DPS, Tank, Buffer, Healer or Debuffer is up to you to take your team to the next level.

Only complaint Controllers. I only rate this 2 stars due to the fact that you lied about the controller support. Nvidia shield controllers- One of the most common- aren't supported. Well at least they break your game... Lemme explain. When you start it up, there is an option to use a controller, having one hooked up (via nvidia shield portable) I select YES. It then proceeds to take me to a screen with the NORMAL moving menu background except without any options to do any thing. (Load game, new game, ect.)

Good. Graphics and controls are all right but as a game it lacks some development. The stealth system is primitive based on distance instead of vision. The story is poorly developed with quests like 'I need your help,  kill one bear'. Maybe Ravensword 3 will be a great game, this one is fun but nothing special.

Get it - that simple. Be aware, the game was released before it was finished - very low on content.  But, it has the potential to be best game ever, though it needs more - a lot more content. It feels half done, like they planned more quest, but never got around to it.  I've lowered my review 1 star because of this - I've been waiting for months, but I have a feeling they are done.  Too bad.

A lot of tuning up to do...for mobile it's an amazing feat...but not the game. The game is just a vivid reminder of where were going in mobile gaming. Tune the graphics a lil, as big as areas are it really is more linear than free roam. Tune the controls, for one they're too slow. I could care less how big and graphically good a carnosaur is if I'm turning like I had a stoke when fighting him. Huge game for Mobile RPGS.

Good game for Star Wars or RPG fans The game itself plays pretty well, with plenty of options for how you want to run your character. I have noticed that triggering your character's special abilities has begun to lag a lot more than when the game first came out (minus 1 star). My biggest complaint is the load time. It takes almost 2 minutes (1min 55sec) from the time you start the app until you reach a screen that you can interact with (minus another star). For the amount of space this game takes up in your device, it should load a lot faster. Also, the developers should put the function to properly exit the game back in (I have no idea why they took it out).

PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT!!! Great game, terrible devs. Just to save you some time and myself some in game sanity, no jedi, no sith, force powers at lvl 86, lightsaber at lvl 100. FINISH THE TUTORIAL  (LVLS 1-11) BEFORE ASKING STUPID QUESTIONS IN CHAT!!!!!

Amazing Star Wars MMO Everything you think it is and more, I would have rated 5 stars, however there is a glitch that stops me from moving which randomly occurs and forces me to close and reopen the app just to fix the issue. Which I find incredibly infuriating, however other than that I love it.

Fun, but not spectacular. I love the sound effects and music and everything that makes this game feel like you're in the Star Wars universe. However character progression bogs down in your 20s and the combat rating gates on missions are too low. If i can finish a mission with nearly full health I think I can handle the next difficulty up with my current gear/level.

Star Wars - at least Disney & Lucasfilm says so... Story: 3 (you are a smuggler in the Star Wars universe between RoJ and FA, the story arc is okay.  Not great, not bad, okay.)  Gameplay: 2.5 (interface is often wonky, errors occur frequently, force closes happen weekly.)  Freemium: 4 (it's hard but you can complete the game without paying for anything.  But it will take FOREVER.  That's not an exaggeration, end game requirements will force you into direct competition with people who have been playing since launch and you have to rank in Sector Battles for "Event Crystals" to meet upgrade requirements.)  Sector Battles: -2 Competing directly against people who have been around so long they have literally every item in the game, is hard.  But to get the advertised Force abilities or Lightsaber you WILL have to compete for event crystals.  Even then, it will take months.  Customer Support: -75 (a team of rabbits weasels with sore teeth would be more friendly and helpful.  They treat you as if you're a liar trying get over on them because their game is perfect.  Of course, when the "multi award wimming" game director, their boss, calls people who give harsh feedback a bunch of whiners, what do you expect?)  Pass this game up.

Update: Was a good little game... Deleting after giving devs time to fix the mess they'd made. Upon the last update, the devs were inundated with serious gameplay issues. Apparently no beta testing used before imposing a game-play  ruining update. I'm pleased a couple issues (not most) had been addressed from their last update, but as a whole gameplay is laggy, costly (time/investment) and PAINFULLY tedious to watch goals/returns  get further and further away.

Only game that penalizes you for leveling You have to farm. A lot. Farming gives xp. Xp gives levels. Levels force you to farm more difficult missions before you have upgraded gear to reliably farm previous ones. Also... competative reward system eliminates you if you arent on a good device, before you even try.... the storyline is very giod though. Pretty much the only reason i still put up with the above and slow load times. Those are the worst of any game i have played

Typical carrot on a stick Simple progression grinder, nothing special but an adequate time killer. Just do not spend any real money on it, outrageous prices for scant reward, they are essentially pushing pixelated heroin for junkies, relying on impulse buying. Just accept you will not get any where fast in this obvious cash cow and be patient. When South Park did the freemium gaming bit, they were satirising games like this, so fair warning. The controls in this game are really poor, often taps not registering or the character not going to the designated point. That is really the only difficulty i've found in this game, fighting the controls is what makes the game any challenge, and this is not how it should be. The challenge should come from well designed content.

Weak and Oversized Gameplay is obnoxious & convoluted. Story drones on without any plot in sight. Visually mediocre. And that's without reaching the multiplayer aspect yet. From what I'm reading in other reviews, I'm glad I never got that far. And it takes up a few gigs of space which could be used for far better things. Forget it. If it wasn't Star Wars, it'd only get 1  .

I originally gave this game 5 stars, but after playing to lvl 90 in 2 different servers, it really got bland.  First, after a server has been around for a good amount of time, you will end up with maybe 2 guilds, and way less than 100 active players. Which gets boring. Second, I started a new server because of that. Well there was a bug, and some players took advantage of it, and were basically removed from that server. In the end, it killed that server, I would say there were maybe 50 or less active players by the time I left. It was completely pointless. My problem is, they keep these servers going, so some noob might join a server, love the game, and actually spend money on runes, just to find out, it's a dead server. They need to merge servers when they get below a certain point, or it makes the game pointless.

A MATAEUS REVIEW      I never, ever thought I'd uninstall the original game, but this version has progressed much further in a direction more suited to my tastes. Full props to the original developer for building an excellent foundation, but Shattered feels, to me, like the logical extension of that blueprint. The  only downside? I'd like to see a lot more achievements! Maybe one for each badge? The current ones are rather generic!

I love it, but it killed the franchise for me. With 1 goal in mind, 100 tries in, desperately, I beat the only boss that drops a persistent item in the game. He does not in this version. Otherwise, this is an upgrade in many ways to the original, I love so many things about this game, but when it comes down to it, I need that drop, and the original doesn't cut it for me anymore, this ruined it, so I guess I quit.

Dev: The warrior's badge loses its power when you upgrade to heroic armor.  The warrior's armor should be upgradable. Also, consider having the badge carry two or three upgrades. Right now, the warrior is underpowered because his combos don't give him enough offensive capability. His defense is supposed to be strong, but the badge is weak.

Never A More Roguelike Roguelike Shattered Pixel Dungeon, and it's similar mods, are the most fun, fair, well thought out/executed Roguelike games in mobile gaming right now. Brutally difficult, it still rewards good strategy and play choices. Absolutely punishing, it brings an immense feeling of satisfaction. It embodies the traditional RL genre by allowing players to learn through their mistakes, but without giving every vital piece of information. It's a mystery, that is more and more fun to unvelop. Play this game. Prepare to die

The cursed wand that makes everything youre wearing cursed There were some mechanics of the game that were changed or altered that I disagreed with, but accepted, but this is too much. It is unnecessary and needs to be removed completely. There is no point to this being a thing. Wearing cursed stuff was a pain but it was always a risk when equipping an item, but a wand that makes all your equipment cursed? The wizard class was already nerfed super hard and now it's pointless to play wizard entirely. Remove this from the game. People plz rate 1 star until they do.

One of the best rogue-likes I can sum this up as an addictive challenge. Five stars due to lack of bugs, the sheer fun I have playing it, and being completely free. No ads! You aren't required to buy anything to keep playing. There's no irritating stamina mechanic limiting your play time. You can play as often and as long as you like. Sometimes frustratingly difficult, you will feel compelled to either learn from your mistakes or to uninstall the game. For those who enjoy the challenge, a fully realized dungeon crawler awaits.

Really does well at that frustrating rouge-like feel Finally beat Shattered after about 100 runs and some frustratingly close calls. It's really a game that you play, rage quit over, later on remember how much fun it was, then rage quit again.
New updates are great! Thanks for updating the game frequently! Not all game Dev. can do that :) .
A fantastic game You like roguelikes? This is for you. Shattered is  in my opinion even better than the original PD now. And it just keeps on getting better.

Absolutely a great game I've had hours of fun with this game, and it is by far my favorite roguelike so far. Love it Easily the most replayable roguelike on all of Android. Only game I have kept on my phone longer than a week. Tight gameplay. Good wiki and explanations. Decently challenging. Good play-arc ie early, mid, lategame distinction. Best of all the pixeldungeons.

Good, but... Still my favorite version of Pixel Dungeon, but recent "rebalancing" has made it much less rewarding. Awesome!!  ...and stupidly addicting.  Really challenges your creative and tactical thinking skills as you're forced to squeeze every iota of usefulness out of every item you have in your inventory...no matter how useless it appears.

So much love The original pixel dungeon was fun as hell... the first hundred times. Development screeched to a halt on that one, and it almost seems to me like shattered is someone getting passed the torch. Constant fixes and tweaks throwing new wrenches in your runs, and the best part, I think, is how it has all stayed true to the realistic no-nonsense style of the original. This. Is. Perfect.
Best Pixel Dungeon Out There Hands down the best Pixel Dungeon out there. Really good balance of difficulty and constant updates makes this a solid way to kill a few minutes.

Difficult but satisfying as heck! So what does this game provide from the original "uncracked" version? A slew of new mechanics, items and some major gameplay changes. Best part is, it works perfectly; the amazing original got an upgrade and it is simply glorious. Just adapt to the difficulty curve and start exploring.

Fun and addicting, tons of hours of dungeoneering! I love it, I love the challenge. It's a great way to sink tons of role-playing hours in. It's great, although a few performance bugs interrupts the floe of the game, this happened with my Oppo Mirror 5, random pauses with sharp popping sounds even on mute. I don't know if it's because of a custom Android OS, but if you can fix the bug, it'll be extremely helpful! Thanks for a great game!

The definitive pixel dungeon option Game is hard, really hard and to be honest I've been playing it for years and I still don't know how it all works, but it's a fanstastic, possibly the best rogue game out on android, I've not tried a ether one, well done Evan!

Finally Well, I finally found the smartphone timewaster I was looking for. After *only* 2 years, I managed kill the boss and get back to the first level. Keep up the good work!

This could be a super epic game.  Initially I played it and the simplicity and ease of play and amount of time needed to feel progress is perfect.  However once you get to tier 4 weapons and armor the rng grind becomes fairly harsh.  Getting lucky on an ornate chest is very rare and the item drops even in tier 3 special are very poor compared to what is needed.  I have gotten a ton of useless fuse gems as well which I can not fuse up to tier 4 which should be fixed to allow it.  So ultimately I am at one of those places where I am stuck on progress which makes me less and less inclined to login and play.  The curve is too harsh and the rng is not that forgiving. Suggestions: Allow tier 3 to 4 fusion for gems.  Up chance of better drops in higher dungeons and at higher levels.  Lower gold cost of traveling merchant fuse crystal (post 45+ you need tier 5).  If your not going to change drop rates decrease difficulty so progress can still flow. Add new enemies there are far too few. Your goal is to keep people interested and smacking them at post 40 with this harsh curve unless they are very lucky or buying diamonds just adds potential we will quit.  Tons of free games out to play.

Last the pvp, its so absurdly one sided its pathetic. Needs completely reworked.. could be a great game.

Deep and loooong dungeon crawl Wow, this took me a few weeks to beat, not something I would expect from a phone game! Please make a sequel!
