Great game. That jarod guy must be new to RPGs, just because you have 110% attack chance doesn't mean you will always hit your enemy, you have to consider their block chance.  You can see any enemy's stats by tapping on their picture under the attack button. There are enemies you can barely get through a fight with as a low level player that won't be able to damage you any at all later on.  Things may seem high priced early on but a little later money won't be an issue and you will have more than you need.

Fun game I really enjoy this game. They have a platform that works great so I just wish they spent more time on new content. Grinding gets old after awhile. Quest are what make this game go by, oh and cool gear.

Could use improvement This is actually my first time playing a classic style rpg and it is an unforgettable experience. I downloaded this three times before i actually decided to give it a try. The only things to make this game better than it already is is to add some music and touch tones, it gets kind of dead without some good music. Also, when is the maps all gonna be input? Or do you just have to complete certain tasks to get farther on like across the river west of loneford. I defeated the river troll. Overall,good game.

I'd be willing to give it five stars If the game wasn't made of dead ends where one would actually be able to go early in the game....instead most areas actually available to be explored are  high level areas...which makes it really boring to level up....oooo let's kill that group of low level creatures 5000 times to get enough gold to buy enough potions to maybe explore and oh....another unfinished area where I can't continue....guess I'll go back to those little guys for another week since nothing else is any good for gold...
Nice game Way to much grinding to level up also skill points sud be every 2/3 levels not every 4. Apart from that I really enjoyed playing the game plz finish it asap

Good but just one problem i found thus far Pvp seems tacked on like an afterthought also i relly hate being forced to fight another player but the current system sets them right in the road so you cant dodge them please fix or at least a disable option of some sort well should count my blessings at lest i dont have to deal with trashtalk

I've put off buying this for so long... Honestly a really fun game. My only issue I have is the controls, but that is me, I'm not a big fan of tap/click to move controls. Over all, super fun and love how you're just tossed into this world and must figure it out on your own. Love it.

F'n Awesome! Needs more content & polish! To start, landscape orientation without screen rotation enabled. Can't wait for III! Love it! An overall improvement of the first... Though I read it's too short..which I wouldn't know, because I'm grinding like there's no tomorrow. Needs instructions, if not just a basic outline of controls & stats. The campfire restores health, but does it save your location and stats/gear. Tap repeatedly to spam attacks. Heart grants extra life. Coin transfers after death. No official exit or save progress button. Wish it had some sort of stash, to save equipment permanently, regardless of death.

Back to 1 star for Special Boss Glitch I had to make this 1 star again because although the boss glitch that freezes the game is fixed, the special boss you can choose to fight at the end (the whole heart tombstone and purple guy with red sword boss) is glitched. Although he does not attack or move, he is invincible. He'll take damage, but it doesn't do anything to his health. Made a one star so this would be noticed.

Love it well worth the small purchase Thanks you for fixing the boss freeze bug it works perfectly now I've just beat the game and restarted over having beaten many bosses and worked perfectly. There is a small amount of lag with stealth enemies ghosts and such but that's it. 5/5 and again thanks for the fix! EDIT: once your dexterity gets high enough that you crit 100% or more lifesteal no longer works and I assume it's the same with other stats lifesteal is essential but does not proc on crits so it never procs once you get high enough level

Pretty good but poor controls Has some great elements but the tap to move controls completely kills it and makes it frustrating to play. Targeting enemies also feels a bit clunky and frustrating. Music, art, and the general idea for the game are great. Can be a bit repetitive after a few deaths constantly starting from scratch, wish you kept more than just the money. Maybe stats or skills or getting some sort of special item or bonus depending on how far you get. Layout and dungeons are not randomized either which adds to repetitiveness

I tried very hard to like this game. Combat is fun, random equipment and leveling up is fun. Game world is nice. Dungeons are well made. But the game has a glaring flaw. No way to pause the game. Even if you hit the home button to minimize the app it continues to run in the background. Enemies can continue to chew on your character, etc. Hitting the back button in game doesn't do anything. Only way to close it for sure is to also remove it from the recent apps list. Annoying.

Awsome, sort of? Different every time! Or so it seems. there aren't really many differences every time you play. And after you beat it. It turns into weapon and armour collection. After playing, Delver immidiatly became my favourite game on my tablet. The touch controls really brought down the game though, so I plugged in my blue tooth keyboard (although the review below said it doesnt work, either the Dev fixed it, or just the type of keyboard) and I used the keyboard to move, pick up stuff, and attack, and used my other thumb on screen to look and manage my inventory, and the game really shined. I love the atmosphere, and pretty much everything about the game. But when you get to the cave levels, they are a little too open and with the beholders it gets really cheap and overly difficult. After watching PC gameplay this issue seems fixed, and Im hoping eventually it will be on here too.

Looks good, pretty challenging. The graphics are nice and nostalgic, and I dig the music. I really dislike the controls. Ranged combat is tough because it can be hard to aim at an opponent far away. Melee can be tough because the attack button is in a weird spot. I kind of wish for turn-based combat. Enemy casters and the beholder guys ruin every game for me. Hope for a resistance potion, or you're starting over. Hopefully I'll find the right stat balance to get me through those fights.

I like the game.  It's fun and challenging and fresh every time.  I used to play the PC version back when that was free (a few years ago or so).  I intend to get the PC version again on Steam and be able to play there.  As for the Android version, controls are a little difficult. Awesome The only thing is that the controls are so hard to use. The attack button is so freaking small, awesome game but controls are bad. Also it would be cool for like a continue our something because of you die you don't have to start from scratch again. But this game has a good concept.

Make online This game is really fun I just beat it and it is still really fun looking forward to new updates. Would be really fun online. Recently tho I have experenced laggs and errors on the file I beat the game on. Please fix and u will get 5 stars

10/10 IGN This is an awesome game with rogue like aspects like when you die it's permanent and you restart. The goal is to get to the bottom kill the necromancer then bring the orb back up to the surface. Sounds easy right? Right? Wrong. It only takes one step to screw yourself over. Either step on a pressure plate, drink a bad potion, run into traps, ect. I think this game is awesome and I strongly Recommend it to any fans of the genre.
Great Dungeons Adventures Thanks to the yogcast I found this game. It just simple RPG dungeon fun. Its simple to play but challenging at the same time. Thank you for a lovely game

Amazing I love the game, and play it any chance I get. I've played more than a few hours worth over the last couple of weeks, and I love every bit of it, except for one error in the dungeon gen. I've noticed that a teleport trap sometimes gets placed in a one way hallway, and it teleports you back to a place you've already been, forcing you to restart and delete the world. Once this little thing is fixed, I can safely say this is the best game on android.

Hopefully it gets updated eventually Like the new features in the update but unfortunately the game can get so choppy at times it's unplayable.  I understand it's still in development so I'll wait and hope it gets better.

Great potential! I understand this game is still under development .That said, for what this game already is, I'm impressed. The developers are taking this game in the right direction. Looping Dungeon Repetitive. In twenty minutes you'll see every thing this game has to offer. The enemies and bosses repeat every four levels. The dungeon's main layout never changes and leaves no room for any exploration. Not worth the time or money.

Glorious It's dangerous to go alone! Do it anyway! Fantastic creation of nostalgia, difficulty, and playability. I have only one complaint: when picking up items, the text is often underneath my thumb. Annoying, but not critical.

Zelda's dungeon crawling + arcade + roguelike Fun, fast, frustrating. First it lulls you into thinking that it's way too easy. Then you die from a silly mistake and are taken aback a little. I've spent a LOT of time playing this game and having fun but there gets to be a point where I want some kind of quest or at least a goal,  not just endless grinding.

A MATAEUS REVIEW      The animations are nice. The music is nice. But that's pretty much it! It's just a clicker, and I didn't expect that. You drag treasure chest items into your inventory, and tap as fast as you can on monsters to despatch them. No quests, no sense of reward or progression; heck, there aren't even any instructions. It's just plain old boring, simple as that. Don't be fooled by the screenshots, as I was, into thinking this is a Zelda clone. It most definitely is not.

No substance Good graphics and interface but let down by the total lack of story, engagement, feeling of progression or basically anything. All you ate required to do is mash the screen and that's it. Badly needs a story, interactions or something to hold my interest. Look at the Banner Saga for an epic game.

Fun little dungeon crawler I like this trend where Indie game devs are releasing their PC games on iOS and Android as well.  This one's been in my Steam Wishlist for awhile, but now I can play it on the go.  Great little C2M (click-to-move) hack n slash rogue dungeon crawler.  If you've never played Zelda before (...seriously?), this game was obviously influenced by it, and will appeal to fans of Zelda, Binding Of Isaac, etc.  Grab this one, beat it, then get the sequel!
Fun and addicting This game rocks.  Brings me back to the old days of playing Zelda on NES and SNES, and playing nethack on my Linux box.
Classic! Addicting! Good old fashioned hack and slash. Like how the game auto saves after dungeon completion. Once I figured out the drag and drop chest system my frustration gave way to elation!

Best RPG experience I've had in years! The story is fairly in-depth, the dialogue is actually dynamic, and the monster progression system is very unique, and is still easy to use. The battles are actually fun when walking through tall grass, and there are no Zubats trying to swarm you in caves. The Cloud load/save feature is definitely a life saver, and the multitude of avatars you can choose from are awesome! Worth so much more than what the price tag shows.

Will rate 5 stars if this is fixed.

FANTASTIC alternative to pokemon, one of the best games on android.   This is similar to pokemon in many ways but there are some differences that I like that I think 1 up pokemon.   For 99 cents you can't go wrong. You can cloud save and play this offline too.  It's completely fair if you don't pay for premium currency, it's not necessary at all. You can go through this game just like how you can go through pokemon. There's perks you can get for your trainer too so you aren't hindered.   I plan to support this game further.  This developer has earned my respect.  BUY IT if you like pokemon style games, you have basically nothing to lose but 99 cents, even then there is a 2 hour refund window on google play.

Not your usual shovelware Usually you'd be right to avoid cashcow series turning into terrible games and spin-offs, but this title is legitimately worth your time.  It is basically South Park: Stick of Truth, but with a Steven Universe plot, visuals, references, and even new stuff you'd expect to find within the show itself. Not only that, but it's fresh. It doesn't feel like rehashed material, but like an episode of its own. The characters have character, they're written as you would expect them to speak, and there is partial voicing of the dialogue in the most important places.  I have only played through the first world and a little into the second so far, and there has already been a decent amount of referencing to the show that could be considered spoilers. I'm not too sure where this game would be set timeline-wise, but it's definitely somewhat deep into season 1.   Give it a chance. I don't think you'll be disappointed if you love Steven Universe.

Really Great for the Price I truly enjoy this game for not knowing much about the cartoon. This is how a RPG should be. It is sad there is nothing else like this. I hope for a higher level cap, more skills, and maybe different fields in the future.

6/5 stars! Great oldschool fun with something for every rpg fan.  Of course the graphics are not modernized but they are good enough to enjoy, as well as helping to set the tone.  The game really sucks you in and is well worth more than the asking price.  Great for 5 minutes, or long playthroughs if you are that lucky lol.  It is NOT pay 2 play/win for the game you buy and dlc is optional but worth it.  Easy to aquire all you need to beat entire game.  EDIT:  Devs need to fix problem with grindstones not spawning.

A fantastic game with great support! Bought this game on a whim. Played it for an hour and found it immensely fun. Decided to buy some gold for it. Wonderfully cheap in game purchase, a whole $1.97. It failed and so I emailed support. The returned to me in about six hours with a code to give me the gold I bought. Quick, easy and fantastic! I definitely recommend and in game purchases are by no means required. I was just excited and eager to get started!

Great mobile game with unforgivable bug I got a new phone, logged into the same Google account I used to play Kopp for about a year, and I can only start a new game.. Please let me know if the game does not save on the cloud and I should uninstall. Otherwise I would love to continue my year long adventure. Update: still haven't heard from paradox about this issue.

Awesomely Original This game is a refreshing romp through a hilarious and original 8-bit Nirvana that is long overdue. If you like rewarding questing and nostalgic humor in an old-school RPG framework, this game is for you. Chiptunes abound and it runs smooth as silk. Not a memory sucking beast either, you'll be able to play for hours on a fresh battery. Love the Dungeon Master twist, and the game characters and NPC's pull it all together. Great game, worth every dime.

An RPG'ers Dream A thoroughly fun & addictive turn based RPG that combines elements of Final Fantasy, Dungeons & Dragons, and old school 8-bit aesthetics. Boatloads of retro charm, appealing graphics, a wonderful in-game sense of humor, surprisingly low battery usage and tons of replay value are just icing on the cake. Whether you want to sit and play for 2 hours or pass 20 minutes in a waiting room this is a great time killer.

Awesome A RPG based on people playing a RPG?!?! Yes haha Its a really good game, however one slight downside is how short the first quest, its not a major downside and now worth taking a star, just a pointer :)

Great game but.... I love this game to bits , I've only played maybe 2 hours of it and have fallen in love with it. The only thing is , I've purchased 3/4 of the huge coin packs but they haven't gone through to the game. I've received a confirmation text from my phone provider saying that it has taken the money but I still haven't received the in game money. I am extremely disappointed in this as this is a great game that's worth five stars but I won't be giving those stars until this issue is resolved
Addicting, but Suddenly said "Billing Error" bla bla. I bought this legally. Just wanna know why it said that. Response please? :)

No point Coming from someone who's beat this game: The character selection process is rediculous; So many choices but very few are even useful. You can learn all you want about the dungeons as you go along but never be able to use anything you know because items drop randomly and you can't store them anywhere so it doesn't matter how tactful you are; having the right tools is a roll of the dice. It's a glorified game of dice: No strategy involved. If you try to play smart, you're only going to be beat by chance.

too difficult chars.keep getting hit by status effects and i have to waste every turn trying to heal. no way to retreat. are there any areas to grind in? what about full screen? im still going to keep trying,i just wish it were a little easier.

Fine...5 stars...but... Fun dialogue...challenging...well put together. But inventory needs work...badly. Just drop less loot. Element system and monster system is not done well. Visually tricky and I hate min max my weapons to fight bosses. If on PC id give 6/10 but on Android still 5/5 compared to competition.

A MATAEUS REVIEW      Well, I'm astonished! What a great game! It's got an excellent learning curve with a great level of challenge, many achievements to unlock and fantastic gameplay. Good humourous writing is accompanied by fantastic graphics and great music, and the whole thing runs super smooth. A really, truly great mobile RPG game!

Setbacks are too huge Played for hours on the first "level", got killed (due to a mistake with equipping the party) and back to square one. Do not know if I can be bothered putting in the effort again. I really cannot see how you are ever going to get near the even harder levels. Life is too short.

Truely well done The game is a retro styled turn based rpg, beautifully done and brutal at times, but easy games are never fun, this game isn't hard by any means but it becomes slowly less forgiving as you progress, basicly a learning curve for those expecting a free ride to victory. Well worth its price.

Awesome Multi TOTAL PARTY WIPES Hard as hell. Starting out you are able to pick from 6 random classes for 3 slots. you unlock a variety of quality and curiosity as you beat SPECIFIC dungeons or if you beat more than X dungeons before your guaranteed Total Party Wipe. Robust mechanics system makes for varied and interesting combat and other challenges, which can sometimes  aid or hinder in massive ways, which makes your initial choice of Class NPC selection even more important
Fun But is there NO way to get back to town while in a dungeon??? My bag is full so it won't let me advance... but all I can do is trash items and lose them forever.

Needs rotate lock The game itself looks great, but you don't seem to be able to prevent screen rotation even when the device has it switched off, makes if impossible to play when lying down, a small thing but irittating.

I have a suggestion For every party death, give small bonuses to future parties.   Each grave could indicate the bonuses, such as 11% more INT for getting far with a mage group. It would add to replay value!

New go to app! Saw this on steam a little while back and wishlisted it there.  Glad I did because this is an AMAZING mobile game. It is very much suited to a grab and go style of game that I don't usually associate with pc. Seems very complete and full featured.  Easy learning curve and very rewarding. Thia game is really fun, and it os challenging at times. Just be prepared with your items to prevent status effects and do more damage, and you will be fine! The only problem I have is that there is not a way to lock your screen.

Very brutal old skool Doesnt forgive. Expects you not to suck. In order to advance, set up complementary parties (tank, heals,dps) and look for eq that grants inmmunities. Research the enemies in each dungeon and get resis to their element and use weapons, skills, & spells that they are weak against. First u survive one dungeon, then you start to buildxp and gear, then it is ez.
Brilliant game! Yes it is difficult but why make it easy? Trying to get the perfect combination of characters to assist one another is enjoyable and challenging!

Almost perfect Great game and refreshing that there are no micro transactions. I would have played double. My only complaint is that the rotation does not stick with the OS's setting. Fun, funny and challenging Lots of nerd references tied into the story. Tons of characters and party customizations that will keep you playing for hours.

This is better then kopp 1 For me i think this really better then kopp 1 story is better and funny and the battle system waaay better then kopp 1 i dont know why the download for kopp 1 is 100 thosen and kopp 2 is only 10 thosen....at this rate they will lose or the profit will not worth the time and money they spent making this game so this mean no kopp 3....guys dont listen to bad review please buy this game if you liked the first one...belive me more better then the first one...and i hope the dev will make kopp 3 i dont mind paying for lots of dlc if it mean getting kopp 3 and 4 and so on

Read alot of bad reviews, so didn't get it. That was a mistake. For anyone who played d&d back in the eighties, this is priceless. The very first monster is the freaking tarasque! I about died. A skeleton of a game, now with DLC! After several freaking months of no updates, they finally release one. Too bad it's DLC, and it's and at mid level players. Also there are still no charms. Why did the previous developers have to give up Knights of pen and paper to these numbskulls?

Fun Retro RPG Never played the original, but the artwork in this one seems much better. The quests are good and often amusing, the story may be a little short but the gameplay makes up for it. With free a free content update and a couple of DLC there is no longer an issue with it being too short.
DLCs When I said 'add more content', I didn't ment you need to pay for extra stuff in the game, really disappointed in a game I loved before
Was upset, but after updates VERY satisfied When game first came out I played it and was really disappointed, but after trying it again after the latest update I love it. .

Great mobile rpg It is fantastic and we'll with the money the expansions are big and worthwhile while still not necessary in order to have a good time and you can dump endless hours into finding the perfect party!

Great Omg this  game is fantastic
Crashes Otherwise, awesome game.

Disappointing followup The original Knights was likely the best mobile game I've played, but this is substantially worse. There's less to do, a world that feels less alive, less characters, less classes, and less story, even with all the DLC. Not to mention the port to Android is sloppy at best. Any time you quit and resume it ends up with a conflicting save that you have to pick one of, and then gives you 1k coins. Every time you start the game. It's lazy at best. Passable if you liked the first &  want a time waster but no more

Very poor support I thought this game would be great, and it was, until I couldn't use the weapon enhancement crafting system. I sent an email request to Paradox and had a response from someone who said he didn't know much about the game and that I must not know what I'm doing. I sent back screenshots as evidence and his response was that I must not have those recipes. However, he did not have a clue where to find those recipes. Not to be found, supposed to be there from the beginning. Very disappointed in Paradox.

Meh Pretty obvious they've decided, rather than charge the right price up front, to scalp as much money as they can, bit by bit, out of you. The "main" game is very bland and quick to complete, most missions lack any real originality or humour like the original game, the expansion pack was even shorter and felt like a cash in, and to make it worse despite my account being linked it still wiped everything after I bought/earned most of the upgrades. Not very impressed. Shame as looked forward to it.

Enjoyable Loved it. It had great diversity, a small world and the quests were a bit annoying with travelling across the realm and back for almost every mission. My only request is a bigger world and some sub-quests. Btw the music was awesome!

Changed KoPaP1 for all the worse Let me say I loved KoPaP1. But all these mechanic changes in 2 are seriously pissing me off. Conditions are much weaker and more unreliable due to the resist system. Gold income is L O W and makes the game feel like a grind, struggling to get money. Respec costing that much is a joke, how am I supposed to experiment with my builds / characters like that?! I cannot recommend this game, having played the 1st one. Such a letdown.

Not bad followup but not enough content for $ I loved the first one. This one pretty good but u blow through initial content really quickly and have to put up more $ for DLC which would b OK but u also get through that quickly.  I found crafting worthless. Would never let me enchant weapons which I never figured out. Needs more DLC and I'll pick it back up but I've seen no signs of this happening.

Great. Minus replay This game is great. It has a dungeon and dragons vibe with the dice rolling and being told by a dungeon master at the table. Very awesome; however once you've beaten the game and finished the quests there is nothing to do besides start a new game with the classes you've unlocked. A new game + system or even some kind of end game dungeon with some truly spectacular loot would be fun.   But once you beat the game there's not much to do in terms of replaying it. Now I wouldn't give the game lower than a 4 ever

Bard's Tale Can not save my game without it becoming corrupted. I really liked the game on the original Nintendo. I was hoping to get an updated version for my tablet.

In-app purchases suck I bought talents for 1.99. The save game that I was told had my purchase never came, and you still took my money. Either you send me my purchase post-haste, or I demand a refund. UPDATE: Now the damn game won't save even on an excellent wifi connection. Get your act together, I'd hate to think i wasted money on an otherwise great game.

Fun but has software bug issues...? During game play conversation text suddenly not showing and no voice during conversation with a character.   New players , after first down load of 28MB you will need up to have free storage of 3.7GB for the HD download profile or choose low resolution version download which will take approximately 40% less storage space to download the game. Have fun!

Don't bother playing, your saved games will be lost This game is great... until you loose all your progress. Played for nearly 10 hours, trusting the in-game save system (and the Google play backup), and one week, i played without net connection. When I connected back, my actual save was overwritten with the old google play one, making me loose one week of play. Other comments complain about adequate save system / corrupt saved files as well. Don't bother playing, you'll loose your time. I mean, how difficult is it to create a reliable save system ???

Update? I don't think that means what you think it means. I really got addicted to this game and everything was working great but then I updated and its been one problem after the other. My save got corrupted the game started glitching out and now my moga controller doesn't work.
It's fun with a good story line. My only complaint is that I bought the bow, but I cant use it yet. Make sure you're nice to the dog and train him to fight.

Issue Game works great on my galaxy s5. But I'm having issues in highland park. MELL isn't opening one of the final barriers. Any clue? It's an issue that isn't letting me move forward. I'd like to give it more stars, and verifying install didn't fix it
Very Funsy. Nice graphics.  Low price. Small bugs in thr game but nothing too serious so far. Lest nothing that makes me want to stop playing.

FUN! Brought from 5 stars to 1. Great game as long as the save works. Corrupts within the first hour and can't load.  This has apparently been an issue since MAY and no comments from the devs or a fix.  Cannot recommend to anyone until fixed.  Very sad as it really is a fun game.  Get your act together please and fix the save issue!
Works great on an HTC sv one. Gameplays smooth having a bit of trouble and I'd like to move my controls around but it works amazing and plays just as good if not smoother than on the console. Sodas

Great game, only ONE problem... SO the game is great.   Just one thing,  don't expect your in-app purchases to transfer when you get a new phone. Also, don't expect tech support to get back to you regarding this,  I spent about 20$ and everything is just gone and I haven't received a response to my 3 seperate inquiries. So, besides that, it's awesome. That's the reason for 4 out of 5 stars.
Awesome Funny, great graphics and so epic. A must for rpg fans everywhere! Had to drop some stars. Cannot complete it due to save games becoming corrupt... Bit aggravating.

Why not? I was skeptical about controls on a mobile (I have a Z3), but actually it works better than most games I've played. I played this game briefly oh so many years ago on PC and I don't regret buying it for mobile. It does drain battery a little and I opted for the larger installation because, you know, PIXELS; but I don't regret getting this game. It's entertaining, absorbing and the port has retained the spirit of the original with the optional purchases not interfeering in anyway. For this price, why not?

Great game. Very funny and plays well on the hudl 2 (hi def). Only problem so far is that every time I go back into the game... It claims my save games are damaged. Only way round this is to force a stop on the game via android settings / apps and then go back into the game. A bit disconcerting! Looks like a fair few people are complaining about this. Any chance the devs can sort this in a patch??? If this was fixed, it would be a 5star game.

Great game but with buggy save This game deserves 5 stars if only game save wasnt buggy.  I lost 5 hours of offline gameplay when i went online again.  Seems that the game OVERODE my local save with the last save from google drive which was 5 game hours old.  What a waste!! :(  Was having so much fun too! Uninstalling...maybe ill pick it up again in the future but too disheartened to continue.  For others, my advice is to always play while connected to wifi....dont trust offline play until devs fix save bug.

Serious waste of money I had bought in game items and halfway through the game all my saves started to become corrupted. Serious problem with the game other than that it is fun. Probably not going to play it anymore because I was so far and now I'm back at the beginning with none of my purchased items.
Space It takes up too much space...... Can't down load the extras to the game because its too large, so I can't play.... Why don't you guys say how much space the game takes before its purchased
Funny and fun Great game so far, loving the humour and the combat seems just right for mobile. Hoping at some point I can get a +5 greatsword or the like...
Loved the xbox game... ... But this corrupted the moment I saved, and has crashed every time I've opened it since. Need a refund. Very disappointing.

I played it on ps2 and this is even more bang for your buck now. The game now includes the msdos original trilogy and gives you options between a standard definition 1.5 gb download or a high definition (equal to the ps2 version) 3.5 gb download. The comedy is entertaining for rpg veterans and potty humored middle schoolers alike. There are different styles of skills to play through with and some different story twists depending on either snarky or pleasent dialog choices. Micro transactions are tucked away in the menus and non-intrusive/necessary.

Working great except for the fact that my saved games are constantly becoming damaged somehow.  This is super frustrating.  Played for eight plus hours for nothing.  I like this game a bunch but whats the point if i cant save reliably.  Please fix this.

Snarky Cary Elwes written and performed, accented dialogue, and an action RPG format to design your own party! Hack n slash, parody send up done right, and running brilliantly in HD on my droid turbo.

Samsung galaxy s4 I love this game and even after I lost my in app purchase the developers REPLYED back and have EVEN gave me my bard topped up back thank you very much n i hope you make part two to it i will recommend this game with customer support aswell not many DO REPLY BACK BUT THESE DEVELOPERS DO AND HELP YOU AND AM VERY GRATEFUL FOR THAT

This game is awesome but... I had a problem. The butcher got killed and I could not progress AT ALL. I also spent money on the game. Lost it all. Had to start over from the beginning of tower 2 . five and a half hours of game play just gone. Did not say anything at first and would have given the game like a 10 star but I guess crap happens to paying customers.
Fun, best phone game yet? Although no crashes, a few bugs that needed a complete phone reboot.
I have spent 6 dollars on this game and the file keeps on getting corrupted . so I think I should get reimbursed or someone should make think right
Bards tale Great,great,great,lots of fun,love the songs. Lord bless Charlie hops the man who invented beer.
Pretty fun little RPG, the controls could be a little better however, all in all I say it's worth it. It's a nice bonus to include the original trilogy.

Hilarious! (Samsung tab 4) Cracks me up every step of the way. Loads of fun. Game play is like Diablo but simpler. It's a must have game! Only complaint is that sometimes I have to exit and close and restart to resolve some bugginess. My save wouldn't load just now and yesterday that dude wouldn't open those electrified walls so I could continue. But I noticed a reboot cures all that so far. I test loading after I save now. Still I'm all about the bards quest and I gotta give it all the stars just from what I've seen it was worth it!

Update messed up multi fire Update today 4/18/15 and on 2/17/15 were not adreesed. Try to battle with a bow, it exposes you to no movement on LG Vista. You can fire but all movement or legends disappear after a double tap.(The newest update when trying to multi fire arrows by tapping now enlarges the screen and cannot move.  On LG Vista 12A. Please fix love the game 5 stars back when you do. Loved this from the original to now. Played them all from the begining!)

Perfect! A definite must-have gaming app. Why can't there be more games like this one out there?....update: wanted a great game to play, so 2 years later, on my new s6, the bards tale is STILL awesome!!  Also, i am having no issues with my saves becoming corrupted. Game is working smoothly, as expected.

Very silly tongue in cheek ARPG. One of the better mobile games I have across. Then again it is a port to mobile so it should be half way decent anyway, right? Found only one fairly low cost and pointless in app purchase. That was for all the artwork, silly songs and in game movies. All unlockable via gameplay anyway so no problem

One problem The game is absolutely brilliant, funny and very addictive but it seems the problem with the saved files getting corrupted has still not been fully fixed since I just lost over 8 hours of gameplay as well and whereas I can pick up the part I was in quite easily by just skipping the dialogues and doing everything as fast as I can, it is still frustrating because nothing seems to work for me and let me keep my saves. Please fix it! Other than that, as a game, full 5 stars.

Decent fun Lots of jokes, too frustrating at times with the difficulty. It's like the game can't decide if it wants to be silly and fun, or unreasonably challenging. Too many times I just hit a wall and have to try it 100 times before I randomly win the fight. Funny dialogue.

Old School RPG, Has Major Issue. It seems to be a good port. Difficult, yes, but still enjoyable. The only problem is my save will not load. It says the chapter progress is damaged, and should be deleted. I am a good few hours through, and I do not want to start a new save. Does anybody know how I can fix this? It's been a few months since I have been able to play. If the developers can fix this, I'd gladly give it 5 stars.

Great game, but it's too buggy! Ever since I started playing, I kept having issues where sometimes cutscenes would not advance. There's a part in the game where a character won't move and you need to quit and reload several times just so you can keep going. I haven't had the cutscene problem anymore, but now, I frequently get told that a save file is damaged and it won't load! And this time, quitting the game won't fix it. Seems like I'll lose all my progress. Fix this, devs, please!

Unplayable Wanted to play original series but when ever you have to go to the keyboard it doesn't work. Unable to create new character, type in spell short cut, or use arrow directions. Highly disappointed.

Amazing My 2nd favorite storyline in a Dragon Quest game. 7 was the best(my opinion) by faaaaar. DQ 5 is a great game, hate the controls, rather play it on the DS. Still I purchase it in hopes SE would make some console games in the US.

Excellent Port I never played the original DQ5 but I always heard it was the best in the series. And I'm actually loving it so far. The music is astounding and although the controls takes some getting used to, I think people looking for a solid JRPG on Android should look no further. Look past the $15- you're getting a worthy game for that price. I do wish the game was overhauled to fit mobile and 'save' anywhere was implemented. Quick Save is such an archaic feature.

Finally, DQV! Like the FF series, I have been a big fan of DQ. I have played all the DQ, and have been a huge fan of the story of DQV and have been waiting for this to come to Android! Like DQIV, the controls will take a bit of getting used to, but the game itself is just like I remember, except for the updated dialogue and character names. I personally don't like the changes since I hold the Japanese version close to heart. Regardless, I still give it 5 stars, great game, story, fun! DS version, choose from 3 girls! =D

Beyond excellent! Easily one of the best video games of all time. Not only is the story first rate, the turn based battle system crushes the pointless ATBs and action elements of other RPGs. Final Fantasy 6 wishes it was half the quality of game that Dragon Quest 5 is. $15 is a steal for this masterpiece.

An excellent traditional JRPG Dragon Quest V is about as pure as JRPGs come. You follow the adventures of a young boy as he grows into an adult. Battles are turn based and challenging. They feel a little unfair sometimes, but never unbeatable. There is a lot of grinding. Expect to fight many battles to earn the levels and money needed to face the challenges at hand. There is a monster capturing element that also takes time. The graphics are nice yet pixelated, and the controls are unwieldy but functional. Highly recommended!

No quick save makes it a real DQ This is my first RPG game ever back on its first release on SFC in early 90s.  This certainly brings back lot of memories.  I dont know if I should be complaining the fact it doesn't have quick save function like all the other remakes in its series.  As this makes DQ5 much more harder to play just like the original one, but also means I have to keep the game running in the  background if I'm not next to a church to safe my process.  Nevertheless, it's definitely a 5/5!

Early consisten crash Right after the beginner dungeon, I go home and sleep, wake up and the game freezes up on my lg g4.  Every. Single. Time. The control pad disappears and I'm left staring stupidly at the screen.  This is completely unplayable.

Good story, bad RNG monster recruitment DQ5 has a great story but lack original characters like DQ4. Except Deborah, all characters are bland. DQ5 features monsters recruitment which sounds great at first but it is poorly executed due to too much RNG. Some monsters are really hard too recruit (healers especially...  Only monster get Omniheal...  3% chance and less to recruit)  and you can easily spend hours and days fighting the same monster and might never get it which brings a lot of frustration and no fun.

Don't let controls complains deter you First let me say this is my first dragon quest rpg to date and while I have yet to finish It, I feel bad for missing out all these years.  Admittedly the controls are a little shaky, especially at first, as it can be a little difficult making a precise turn into a stairway sometimes.  However the benefits of having a clean interface that obscures so little of what is even in this age a very beautifully designed and animated game far outweigh the occasional directional hiccup.  Definitely a must buy!

You did it again. Why? My arthritis makes it extremely difficult to play a game of this complexity without a stylus. You obviously can make a game compatible with my S-pen. DQ1, DQ2, DQ3, FF1, FF5, FF6...all are compatible with the S-pen. DQ4,  DQ5, and DQ8 are not. I see the pattern now, though. Thanks to your short - sightedness,  I won't even bother with DQ6. Thanks, SE. It was a good run while it lasted. I guess I will just have to stick with Final Fantasy and blow off Dragon Quest.

Good times Dragon quest V probably my favourite among them. Though I prefer the old dejap translation from the snes version. Like all the phone rpgs I've played I find the controls finicky the dpad deciding to go down when hitting up.

Autosave is garbage While the game is great the autosave is not.  Answer a phone call and you could lose more than an hour of gameplay because it won't auto save in a dungeon. Happened to me 3 times already (and once after recruiting a rare monster).
EPIC I so love this game. DQ V is among my favorite in the series. I can't wait for VI. I like how like with DS they gave you Deborah to choose. She is by far my favorite bride
Another hit Just have to ask. Once you get back to Dragon quest 8, will you make 9 and 10? Thats how many there are right? 10 Dragon quests?
Please fix the game cause when it updates everytime my profile is deleted . I didnt buy this game for it to delete on me. It will be five stars if you fix this. This is for  a sony xperia M2

Dragon Quest      DQ V                                                                                                 (                  )  [love this, but select language (English, Japan, Thai Support )].~* LOVE DQ /   Sad, my device  can't play this game. please help me (SAMSUNG GALAXY TAB S2 9.7) display scale - 4:3

It's not as good as it could be. The controls are at best, terrible. The game also only allows for portrait mode, why can't SE allow landscape mode as well? Limited, half-assed port. Would be better to buy a NDS & this game.

Awesome A flawless port of the DS version, with some added touches to the GUI and optimised for Android devices, it runs incredibly smooth, the controls are a little weird at first, but after a few minutes you get used to it and it feels natural, keep up the good work.
Just a little feedback... The game is great as it is now, but I would like to se some little tweaks to the battle interface, at least to the characters' portraits.
Never played the original DQ5 I just got to the second generation and its a good challenge. Requires some grinding but not too excessive (not yet anyways) I like the story so far.
Great Game It's good. Can't really say much negative things about this game, besides the grindy nature,  but that's a flaw of the series in general

Great game! It's really a shame that the Dragon Warrior/Quest games are not more popular in North America becuase they really are great games. Been playing them sence the 80s and this is my first time playing 5. It's plays well and so far the story is really good. It really goes to show that smart phones can be good for legitimate gameing and not just crappy micro transaction games. This is a real rpg ment to be a fun rpg. I am very much so looking forward to dq7 hitting the app store as the origonal was my favorite.
FIVE STARS!!!  I put 1 to get attention.  I REALLY want DQ VII for 3DS, but if SE only releases it for mobile I will still buy it.  #DRAGONQUESTFORTHEWEST !!!

Great game, also for those who are unaware, there is a quiksave function just open the menu, and for the controls you don't exactly have to use the d-pad, touch and drag from anywhere on the screen and it still works. STOP WHINING... love the series lol
Thank you! Never had the chance to beat 5 & 6.  Excellent ports, THANK YOU!  - Droid Turbo.
Please add Quick save everywhere Love the game. Please add the ability to quick save anywhere. It's a mobile game and I don't want to have to search for a save point to stop playing.
Galaxy S3 Only played an hour of it so far and I like it except I feel the control pad is too sensitive
Runs smooth, no crashes yet.  Switching apps, this one is always right where I left it.  Amazing game, and a solid implementation on Android.  Well done!
Would be awesome if portrait mode and controller input was coded in.  Would love to play this on Nvidia shield handheld or TV.

Every little interruption causes loss of progress Everything, every phone call, text, and alert that you check or answer and you lose all your progress going back to your last auto save this is absolutely game breaking. Didn't notice untill it was too late now I can't get my money back.... thanks alot... add a quick save function and this game would be a 5/5.

Great Game, but Android port still needs lots of work I was thoroughly enjoying this game, until I got to the "ten years later". At which point, the game simply ceased to work. It will come up, allow me to load my status, then freeze when I start to explore. And it never freezes in the same spot twice. $10 wasted.
Omg! This is the best dragon quest game ever! Thank you very much SE!
Love it but. Please make dragon quest  1 and 2 available for the note 4
Best game! Works well on my LG android phone, the game is worth playing but the controls take a while to get used to.
Awesome! It's great to see these games coming to mobile. Especially not free to play. Full game 1 time fee just like it should be.
Great story My favorite storyline in the series.   Glad to have it on mobile finally.

A classic finally portable Yes I know this is on Nintendo DS but what I really like about this version is that it has cloud backup capabilities. Now I don't have to worry about loosing my DS with dq5 in the cartridge slot and permanently losing my progress. The only down fall to this game is that its too big for my 4gb HTC Desire so I have to play it on my very heavy tablet. It gets tiring having to constantly hold my tablet when I'm playing this game. It'd be nice if an update were released that gave the game auto screen rotate capabilities so I could use my tablet's kickstand and rest it on my chest when I'm playing.

Autosave... Isn't reliable. It isn't mean closing the game at all. It's still in my active tasks but I just lost a hour or so of grinding. That's infuriating. Please fix squarenex the game deserves better than that.  It happens after 10 minutes or so of being put in background processes. Squareenix I know youve been unreliable with supporting your games. Please don't suck this time.
Great game,  great price Easy controls and never freezes or crashes. Same $$$ as used game store.

Best game ever I would give this a 1000000000000000000000000000000000000 stars if I could This is officially my favourite game in the universe if there was a remake on the Nintendo nx this year I would pay the full price as long as I could transfer my game data from this version
Please do this Imagine if prodigal isn't dead she just got taken to versus. That would be the best plot twist ever!

Worth the money At first, I wasn't really into the story. The beginning didn't grab my attention and the culture felt like it could be presented better. That being said, the story really grew on me and I felt the culture was present MUCH better later on in the story. I enjoyed the characters and I can tell...this can become a very large series. Well done  .

Boring, do not buy. The story refuses to progress as if it's dragging it's feet. Every chance to move forward is replaced by needless descriptions.  I love COG stories but I wouldn't recommend this one. It's a shame I paid first to find out I didn't like it. At all.

Where to Begin... It feels like you're stuck in a constant prologue. Not to mention that the narrative seems to punish you if you don't agree with the "preferred" path designated by the author. The two characters open for a romance are, quite honestly, appalling to me on a moral standpoint. Wait for the next one...and check its reviews on the choice of games website and forum.
Great Love the descriptions and choice of action. One of the best choice of games i have ever played. Love intergalactic games and things that reference real life societal situations.
WOW I have played many choice of games before. But man!! This blows them all away. I cannot WAIT for the next one. I never wanted it to end!

The best one yet This is by far the best works I've read by you guys so far. Longest book I have read from you guys so far and very interesting. Absolutely willing to wait as long as it takes for the next part to arrive. Well done guys I'm totally impressed with this book.
Just read it! No seriously! I enjoyed reading this book soooo much. If you're thinking about getting it, just do it!

Really loved the first book can't wait to see the next the characters are all  so individual with their own goals and desires it's great getting to know them seeing how different they all are and the story is so well written I can visualize how it all looks and feal to be on planet versus.
I love the heck out of this, sure sometimes there's a bit of a stumble and I need to reread to understand, but its worth the money
Amazing I love this one so much the story and the decisions you can make plus the powers you can get just amazing!
Details I really enjoyed the depth of this read.  Hoping the new book comes out soon. Thanks for putting so much work into this, it shines through in the experience.
Great story I am definately going to reread to unlock all the acheivements.

Can't wait for the next one! I got done reading the Hero's Rise trilogy and needed another great choice of games novel. Versus is just what I needed. I love the story and the stats pages. This game has a great story and your choices build up your character as if it's and rpg. Lots of choices and romance options and achievements are huge plusses for me. My only complaint would be that this is a 123k word novel when I'm used to 200-250k word novels for the same price. Wish this was longer and hoping the next one is. Still, 5 stars!!!
Can't wait for the sequel Loved this book, although there are a lot of spelling mistakes,  which can be off putting.
Liars Game is priced at $4. I buy the game for $4. Twenty minutes in the game is trying to get me to pay another dollar to "unlock" another feature.
Omg I loved all of it. The relationships, stats, and how it made me feel.
Fantastic One of the most in-depth stories by far!
Versus delivers Great story, great system to keep track of powers, can't wait for the next one!
Awesome Style I love the world and the characters, really well written and cant wait for it to continue
I enjoyed this one a lot. This solves the issue of hero projects "give all characters some lines even if they are just sidekicks". Making the pacing way better
Ready for more Can't wait for the next one
Just amazing! It is written very well and is very creative. I hope there is a sequel in the future
More Please continue this! I want more!
When is the next one comng out T.T
Again  really??? paid for the game only to have parts locked behind  micro  transactions.
Please make more The story is awesome and I'm going to have to wait for the second part, but I hope that you make the next part pretty soon=)
loved it! can't wait for more.
Sequal please Love playing this over and over another please
Great story with lot's of hard decisions
Great game great descriptions enjoyable replay value but when is the second part coming out?
Face paced excellence rge story has a great gast pace that kept me hooked
Great It was well worth the play through. Cant wait for the next one.
Omg!!!!! Best one I ever!!!! I need more!!!! Please get part 2!!!!!!
Amazing. Enough said.
Epic Full of mystery and wonder
I like it
Loved it just as much as hero rise. Do you have an estimated time for the next book. I really want to continue with the story :D
Overwhelming Truly beautiful and captivating story as always from you guys, can't wait for the next one.

Can't wait for the next one! Takes a while to get into due to the amount of new terminology you have to learn, but by the end it actually feels like your choices have made a difference. Looking forward to the next instalment!
Great game, but... Only opens if you have an internet connection  which somewhat defeats the purpose of a mobile game.

Good game, bad world movement I'll start off by saying I've played this game ALOT at different points in my life, so it is a great game for sure. If you have the option to, I'd say play it on snes, gba, or emulation of one of those. The movement is so stiff and I'm not sure I'll fully get used to it. The movement pad will 'stick' on screen for a few seconds after you let go while trying to adjust, so it is very anti user friendly. I played ff3, ff4, and ff5 without any qualms about their movement system, so not sure why they changed ff6

Not connecting grrr Just keeps coming up Connection lost and can't open  I payed good money for this and it should work flawlessly  and should be able to pay with out Internet connection    FIX THIS NOW

The Touch Screen D-Pad Sucks!!! The on-screen D-Pad is just horrible and its pointless to try and play while I'm out and about. Good thing it has bluetooth controller support or I would have wasted my money.

Great game Just one issue ,i have a problem start up wise ..like why do i have to have a network connection for the game just to start up it should be able to start up offline without the need for a connection please fix this ,as for the rest of the game its great brings me back to super nes days and then foward to todays technology ,a very good looking game

My God I Love This Game! My favorite game of all time! Used to have to rely on emulators to play on the go, but this new version is fantastic so far. No issues whatsoever, I'm loving everything about it. Clouds saves are great. Kind of bothered by the need for a connection to play, how can I kill time in the woods if the game won't initiate? (2013 Moto X, Fire Phone CM11)

Controls are bad Not very far into the game yet but it doesn't take long to notice how bad the controls are. I have been playing FFV and the controls are amazing. Then to come to this its a real shock. Besides the controls it looks great. Fix the controls and I'd give 5 stars.

A good remake The classic is reborn with new and updated character models and updates backgrounds.  I am not that far in yet but so far the game is fun and enjoyable.   Some of the text is a little different from the SNES version you might remember but nothing major so far.    The worst part so far is the control pad...it is really hard to get used to and could use some tweaking....perhaps something more along the lines of what Final Fantasy Dimensions contained.   No other complaints, the game game runs well.

Love the game but hate.... The game is great. Only thing I have a complaint about is it needs an internet connection to launch every time.... I understand doing it once in while, like once or twice a month every time is ridiculous.
Favorite game of my childhood Only thing i don't  like is the directional pad center moves around screen want option to anchor it more like the snes emulator easier to use fine controls.
Was great, but is stuck in a loop Battling to protect Banon, half way through the game, a soldier reached him so now I get to watch the same 1 second of game play perpetually. Dumb. Lazy.
Online only SNES game? Bought this for plane flights with no connectivity, for which it is completely useless. Game won't even open.
I still hate the fishing, but... Overall I can't come up with a good complaint, bringing back one of my favourite childhood jrpg's just melts my heart. 5/5 nostalgia stars

Seriously? The game is very enjoyable. There are some MAJOR problems though. Sabins blitz commands aren't in the game. And the game freezes is Thamasa. Has anyone gotten past this? Without spoiling anything it's right when Kefka says "illusion". Cyan is actually useful now because you don't have to wait while he charges. You select the command and he waits while you can give your other characters commands. The control out of battle is a bit weird. Fix the freezing issue and I'll give it a 5 star.  *Fixed bugs.

Great game but some issues with this version. A few things.. #1. People have already mentioned that the game should be accessible offline and I definitely agree with this. #2. Is it possible to 'fix' the d-pad rather than having it come up and go away? It would be so much less hassle if it could just stay in a place. With the way it is now, it jumps around and gets extremely annoying! #3. Is there a setting to make the screen not turn off while the game is open? This is also quite irritating and causes the game to crash at times =/
Very great This is a very great version of this game good work on making it but the only setback is that it drains battery very quick other than that its great

Clunky interface, but excellent game D-pad is not good. It's too big and doesn't disappear immediately when we remove our finger from the screen. It's really frustrating at times. Wayward Soul is much better in that respect. It's easily fixed and I hope they will do it. Battle control are not perfect either, but good enough. Drains a LOT of battery. Overall it's still very enjoyable. My favorite FF of all time! The game by itself is 5 stars. The port, only 4 stars, which saddens me. I want to give 5, but honestly can't. Still recommended!

Game is fantastic, controls VERY ANNOYING This is my favorite game, yet the controls are blocky and the lag on movement is horrible, I'm to the end of the world of balance about 17hrs of gameplay and I still have not been able to get adjusted to the controls, I feel bad for first time players especially for parts that are timed like the Opera scene/ultros I had to redo 2x myself considering it's impossible to not run into/avoid enemies and even worse walls because of the movement controls. Furthermore, controls+sprint shoes=WORSE FIX PLEASE

Classic game. Great port. FFVI easily ranks high on my list of my favorite games of all time. I don't know how many times I've played through it in the past, but it definitely a game I can play over and over so I had to buy this. My first impressions of this port are extremely positive. The graphics look great and I love that you can play it entirely and comfortably with one hand. Easily one of the better Final Fantasy games. I couldn't recommend this more.

Fantastic game, sometimes glitchy This is a great port of FFVI! It has all of the awesomeness of the original and more, with achievements making it even more challenging and fun. The quick save feature helps when issuse arise with your phone. The app crashes from time to time, most frequently when Gau returns from learning rage techs in the Veldt, wasting a lot of valuable time when trying to do so. Other than that, great game!

Great additional content, graphics, auto battle! My favorite game for SNES. Many improvements in this iOS version are appreciated! The D-pad is based on where you touch the screen, which makes tonnes of sense, because at different points in the game you want to move the D-pad so you can see surroundings. Dragons den is fantastic add-on. Love quick save option. Some of the updated translations are better, some worse. I wish combat controls were clearer, I select the wrong monster all the time. Never crashes, runs smooth on HTC One M8. Buy this!

Great game. Draconian online only DRM. This is a great port of an amazing game. The controls are a bit dodgy, but the game is otherwise fantastic. The biggest black mark against the game which prevents me from giving a five star rating is the disgusting anti-consumer DRM that requires you always be online to play the MOBILE game you paid for. This game is essentially a rental since you'll no longer be able to play it when the authentication servers are shut down. Remove the DRM and I'll give it five stars.
Improved Got this on a sale and was bugged by a horrible control lag.  The lag is gone now,  we'll,  almost.  So here's 5 stars    time to relive my most cherished rpg memory

Great Game & Work... Loved this game growing up and with the face lift this app gave it Love it still. No problems with loading, saving, Internet connection, cursor, nor Sabins Blitz cursor which was worried wasn't going to be smooth when downloading but in fact works great. Minor issue in recovering Locke from Star Mountain Range, when using Strago, Mog character shows in place of during battle scenes, though all actions including Lore remains. Look Greatly Forward to continuing the Final Fantasy collection, completed all prev

Crummy Control I purchased this game thinking I would  be playing one of my all-time favorite Final Fantasy games. Everything is here , including some revamped graphics. However; the game suffers from very poor controls. I've tried the 4 way and the 8-way controls. Each lags severely. Also at key points in the game , it can disrupt gameplay. 1 key place is the opera scene. I hate that my experience with this awesome game has been tarnished simply by game controls. And, I honestly wish there was a way to get my money back.
Can't stop I can't stop playing this game. Had every version sense the SNES. Story never gets old and the main villain you can't help but love and hate

Awesome. Always wanted to experience this game and now I finally get to on a touchscreen!!! The cloud save is an awesome feature! I can play seamlessly with more than one device. The game has awesome music. Only problem w the game is that I wish thr graphics were morr consistant. Either redo all the graphics one way, or leave it.
Very nice mobile remaster Brings back a lot of memories. If you are a ff fan then it's worth the admission.

Not perfect I just finished ff4 and ff5 on android and both were good.  Ff6, the on screen controller is much more clumsy feeling than 4 or 5.  My other major complaint is that it crashes when you try to open it while offline.

Best Game of All Time I was a long time fan of ff7, and always scoffed at those who said this game was better. Well, I stand corrected. This game changed how I perceive reality; it really is that excellent. The movement can be a bit squirrelly at times but the game is so sexy that it is easily overlooked. Buy it.

I have no idea why, but this game consumes a *ton* of battery.  It even seems to use battery even while it's in the background, unless you force close.  Combined with the DRM that requires an Internet connection to play, and you may have trouble getting this game to run on wi-fi only devices while travelling.
Great format Great integration to a mobile device.  The format is great and easy to use.  Loved it way back when and love it now.

It's an alright MMO... OnC2 isn't a terrible game, but, it has its faults. Such as: Pay2win if you're aiming to be at the top. Some events require runes, like, Nicks Treasure thing, which required you to pay Runes only to get lucky to get Runes, liek, wut? People do complain about the Vigor system, I don't mind since I don't play for a long time, I'm also not aiming for the top. It also does run a little slow, but, that's only my device, so, not a big deal. Overall, if you're looking for a decent MMO, try it out. But, if you aim for the top, avoid it.

DO NOT SPEND REAL MONEY ON THIS GAME.  I paid for a 'One time offer' deal in the Diamond shop. Paid about $30 on a deal for a 'Special sack of diamonds'. Didn't get what I paid for. Contacted support and got told several times I was blatantly lying. Sent the photos of the game for proof, also sent them the receipt I got in the mail for it. They then tell me: "Well you can purchase it again if you want then."  Why would anyone buy something again if they didn't get what they paid for in the first place??? I'm not going to walk into a store, buy something and only get half of what I paid for. That doesn't make sense. What a money grabbing company that they can't help the paying customers with issues. Great concept and interesting characters. Energy to perform actions replenishes very slowly. Resources (gems, gold, energy, etc.) do not last very long. You can get diamonds through offers, but they are hit and miss. Don't bother with survey offers, especially if they have a high diamond value. The sponsors try hard to confuse you and redirect you off track - even if you are able to navigate their maze of redirection, they rarely pay out. You can play for free but it will take you forever to be competitive vs. people who spend money. Basically it is a pay to win game, but it is pretty addictive.
Addicting Started because of cash for apps. Can't stop. Easy idle rpg that's incredible addicting with hillarious names and captions hidden in. Great app

Kinda crappy The game itself is alright, easy to keep busy and I rarely run out of energy.. force closes all the time though which makes me lose my experience and rewards after a battle. Sometimes it restarts multiple times in a row or loses connection to the server. I am deleting soon if they don't fix the connection problems, it's really annoying to have the game crashing all the time.
Amazing app I played it the first time in my life and instantly became in love with the game. Every time I am bored or just lazy that game is always there for me and snapchat! Lol
Amazing 0 glitches, suuuuperrrr addicting, new characters and awesome levels it totally deserves 5 stars

Fun yet disappointing Too much $ invested to quit. It is a fun game. However, there are many issues and annoyances relative to cost. Little is done to appease loyal supporters for glitches that result in loss of in game items and time invested. I hope they fine tune this game and show some love back towards the player community that supports it. There are no excuses for the amount of errors that exist. More forgiveness would be offered if the dev's delivered more attention to the issues at hand with humility and transparency.

GAME RUINED Runes have completely ruined this game. Love that I've spent over $1000 on this game for you to completely change the gameplay. This game is trash now. The game overall is pretty fun.   Heroes are quirky and amusing, the animation is well done, and game features are all pretty good.   There are a few balance issues, but they are working on them often.   Updates come on regular basis and generally well done.    Support is slow, but if you don't need any, the game is well worth it,

Fun and addictive. I love the game and sneak play all the time even during the night. If you have an issue then the PerBlue team addresses it and works diligently to resolve it. Graphics are great and heroes are hilarious.

Funny n classy mmm likin it actually.pity I had to turn off the chat....most the conversation is unnecessary and totally disgusting to be slagged off in a game by immature idiots who cnt stop spilling abuse n rubbish...apart from that this game is brill,sorry to down grade from 5star because of your patrons

Fun time wasting RPG. An entertainingly light hearted style and interesting character/skill combinations keep this simple RPG fun. Yeah, it's a freemium game, but doesn't ram it down your throat as long as you don't get caught up in the rankings.
Boring & slow. Ugly graphics, boring game play, incredibly slow fights that are entirely too repetitive. I was hoping the comedic writing might help but the humor isn't very entertaining.

Getting more tedious with every update. I think perblue forgot this is a phone app, and not a massive rpg. Drop rates are terrible. Stamina  refreshes cost too much with bad returns. Game is completely unbalanced now. People quitting left and right... you dropped the ball pb.

Fun, zany humor. Addictive & can be expensive! Loads of fun, especially when you find the right guild. If you want to spend real cash you can, just be aware that in game prices go up exponentially! What seems like a lot can evaporate rather quickly... Also, as of this review, they have 5 servers. You can create heroes on all 5!!!

DON'T SPEND YOUR REAL MONEY ON THIS! You basically are required to spend money if you want to play this game. Great Little Diablo-like Fun little RPG. Better than generally everything on the Play store. Yes it's a bit repetitive and can be grindy, but overall it feels less amateurish than most. Plus a single $1 purchase removes ads AND gives you gear. That's some real developer generosity.  Just make it clearer you can use ONLY Google Play or a dedicated sign in. I had tons of errors signing in until I realized I could only use one or the other, and obviously I'd rather use Google Play to track achievements.
Mystical fun! Love the save your teammates, band together, and defeat evil scheme.

Enjoyable grindfest Flows nicely from one battle to the next. Lots of item drops, and the crafting system is satisfying. Easy to freeplay so long as you are patient and happy to grind gems, but the crafting and attack upgrade times may be frustrating to those who want to binge the game as soon as possible. EDIT: 2016/5/6: very responsive developer regarding glitches, really impressed.

Good game for Star Wars or RPG fans The game itself plays pretty well, with plenty of options for how you want to run your character. I have noticed that triggering your character's special abilities has begun to lag a lot more than when the game first came out (minus 1 star). My biggest complaint is the load time. It takes almost 2 minutes (1min 55sec) from the time you start the app until you reach a screen that you can interact with (minus another star). For the amount of space this game takes up in your device, it should load a lot faster. Also, the developers should put the function to properly exit the game back in (I have no idea why they took it out).

Star Wars - at least Disney & Lucasfilm says so... Story: 3 (you are a smuggler in the Star Wars universe between RoJ and FA, the story arc is okay.  Not great, not bad, okay.)  Gameplay: 2.5 (interface is often wonky, errors occur frequently, force closes happen weekly.)  Freemium: 4 (it's hard but you can complete the game without paying for anything.  But it will take FOREVER.  That's not an exaggeration, end game requirements will force you into direct competition with people who have been playing since launch and you have to rank in Sector Battles for "Event Crystals" to meet upgrade requirements.)  Sector Battles: -2 Competing directly against people who have been around so long they have literally every item in the game, is hard.  But to get the advertised Force abilities or Lightsaber you WILL have to compete for event crystals.  Even then, it will take months.  Customer Support: -75 (a team of rabbits weasels with sore teeth would be more friendly and helpful.  They treat you as if you're a liar trying get over on them because their game is perfect.  Of course, when the "multi award wimming" game director, their boss, calls people who give harsh feedback a bunch of whiners, what do you expect?)  Pass this game up.

Update: Was a good little game... Deleting after giving devs time to fix the mess they'd made. Upon the last update, the devs were inundated with serious gameplay issues. Apparently no beta testing used before imposing a game-play  ruining update. I'm pleased a couple issues (not most) had been addressed from their last update, but as a whole gameplay is laggy, costly (time/investment) and PAINFULLY tedious to watch goals/returns  get further and further away.

Only game that penalizes you for leveling You have to farm. A lot. Farming gives xp. Xp gives levels. Levels force you to farm more difficult missions before you have upgraded gear to reliably farm previous ones. Also... competative reward system eliminates you if you arent on a good device, before you even try.... the storyline is very giod though. Pretty much the only reason i still put up with the above and slow load times. Those are the worst of any game i have played

Typical carrot on a stick Simple progression grinder, nothing special but an adequate time killer. Just do not spend any real money on it, outrageous prices for scant reward, they are essentially pushing pixelated heroin for junkies, relying on impulse buying. Just accept you will not get any where fast in this obvious cash cow and be patient. When South Park did the freemium gaming bit, they were satirising games like this, so fair warning. The controls in this game are really poor, often taps not registering or the character not going to the designated point. That is really the only difficulty i've found in this game, fighting the controls is what makes the game any challenge, and this is not how it should be. The challenge should come from well designed content.

Weak and Oversized Gameplay is obnoxious & convoluted. Story drones on without any plot in sight. Visually mediocre. And that's without reaching the multiplayer aspect yet. If it wasn't Star Wars, it'd only get 1  .

That game has a simple system that works quite well. For a moment.   It gets extremely repetitive after you hit lvl50 with your hunter, which is, by the way, the max level for your hunter when your guardians can hit lvl60... (Has nobody noticed that at nhn ? Or are you all just lazy ?) To sum it up, the game goes from dungeon crawling to exp & rune (what you need to evolve your guardians) farming and then, level 50, it's just plain zombie (exp material for your guardians) farming and occasional boss fights...   Another annoying point is the bad level of English that is written all over the app, let me get you an example:  "freeze souls appears near philly and heavily damages for 10 seconds"  Another example is the developers too stupid to double check their texts for typos, it's been since the daily missions update (1 month or so) that the "arean" typo hasn't been corrected.  On the bright side, for a free to play, the paying elements aren't too invasive even though the prices are ridiculous, and don't really block you from getting sick guardians, even though luck has the biggest role here.   In conclusion, not a bad game, but the developing team behind it really needs to step up their game and give it a real fresh breath

It's an okay game for it's genre. I've played a number of them in search for one that doesn't become a boring grindfest. But this isn't it unfortunately, as after awhile it does become a grindfest. The AI won't be able to clear anything on it's own, even stages ten levels below it's own level.   And on the subject of AI is the Guardians seem have a bug, I like to believe it's a bug, where they won't attack the enemy and just follow you around even though the enemy is right there and is chasing you. I play primarily as a sorceress, so ranged combat. Happened to me in a boss raid and on stage play.   And then there is the arena/coliseum, which is straight up autoplay with little control from you beyond pick teams and poking their portraits. While yes I use autoplay, it can get really dull watching idiot AIs fight..I know their health is suppose to compensate for their simplistic AI. Maybe I got use to my other game that is also a grind but the AI clears it pretty quick (faster if it's a lower stage) as the AI isn't as stupid and can clear things on their own.

High quality game that deserves way more download! Played the free version like a year ago (maybe more) and really liked the game. But there were always some little things that were bugging me, especially the fact that the characters were moving too slow. I guess there was really something special about the game since a year later, I still had that game in my head and just decided to buy the game anyway. Was I ever surprised when I started playing! The characters were now moving fast and the interface itself became more polished. I soon learned that the Trese Brothers were very good at regularly updating the game (even though they've also got newer ones to work on). All my complaints have been solved and what I'm left with is a superbe tactical RPG with intense combat and interesting skill system as well as an interesting story to follow. It's a shame the game is not more recognized.
Hero's of Steel Reminds me of old school dark sun games. I love this game and play it every chance I get.

Great TRPG Good variety in skills allows you to set up very unique and differing parties even without purchasing any of the alternative characters. You're nearly constantly fighting nontrash quality enemies, which is what you want to do when you're playing a game. You can always try out the free version to see if it's your cup of tea.
Best turn based rpg I downloaded this as soon as it came out and have played several different teams. The story is great and the game play is outstanding.

Best game I own. Period. I've been playing HoS since day one, and after purchasing every new character, have played well over 150 unique and powerful groups using the 8 available characters. Not every group has what it takes, and therein lies the replayability of the game. With every group, you learn what works and what doesn't, improving with every play through. One of my favorite parts of this game is the constant combat- minus backtracking, combat accounts for 75% of the game, and makes for a great experience!
Very nice game. They should be making more games like this one.
