Best messenger app I love using Line and vastly prefer it over its competitors Whatsapp and Kakao. In its core functionality, it's not much different considering each of these apps has free voice and video calls and allows you to send photos and videos. However, what distinguishes Line from the rest is its ability to log in using Facebook, it's convenient photo album and note capabilities, it's pleasing aesthetics and finally... Brown and Cony!

Audio Bug The video and voice call volume turns up by itself and when put on speaker, the noise switches from speaker to the earpiece. To switch it back, you must plug in headphone jack and pull it out. When a photo/audio app opens, the call drops. Not sure if it's just my phone model (Samsung Galaxy Light T-399) or Androids in general. Also, when both parties turn their camera off it no longer switches to voice call, which is a bit inconvenient. But other than that, the call quality is excellent & stable! Thank You!

I've only had this app for a couple weeks now, and I actually think the "Good for Enterprise" app was better, not by much though! I'm not sure if anyone reviews the experiences of others before deciding what application to go with. I know if I saw so many negative reviews, I'd think twice about switching all my employees over to something that will be nothing by headaches!  I installed BES12 on my new device, a Samsung S5 since my employer is moving away from Good... From the very beginning it would take several hours to receive emails at times, and emails that I sent would hang out in my outbox for hours. I contacted our help desk and heard from an outside support rep about one week later.  I was on the phone with this rep for ONE HOUR, she had me uninstall and reinstall the app 4 times, because each time something would pop up on my device that she had no clue why. Ugh!  Fast forward one week later, and my email is still hit and miss, I sent an email to myself last night just before midnight, it arrived at 3:40 pm today! I rely on my mobile email for work since I'm on the road all the time... This is totally unacceptable!

Poor Regularly looses the ability to send / receive email with no error message to tell you so. Highly irritating when you find emails sent yesterday are stuck in the outbox. Not an Internet issue. Not a server issue either. IOS devices work fine... Only a problem with android. Only a phone restart seems to fix the issue. Blackberry support is poor at responding to this and other issues.

Email done right This is an email client done right. Gmail has issues with my exchange account. For some reason, when i reply using gmail on my exchange account, my reply gets cut. Mailwise does not have that issue.

Great app. I like the way I can combine my inboxes. The conversation view is also great. Better than the Gmail app that keeps crashing.  Easier to configure than the Microsoft Outlook app.  Would like to see integrated calendar.

I wanted to love Mailwise. I really did. It's got a clean, easy-to-use interface, and is nicely responsive. But there's a fundamental flaw.  Unlike any other mail app I've used (stock, K-9, BlueMail, others) Mailwise cannot manage to sync my Sent and Trash folders with my IMAP folders or map them from the app, so I can't read my Sent & Trash from other devices. This may be a problem specific to my setup with Bluehost mail servers and your mileage may vary, but for me, it's a fatal flaw.  I tried for over a month to get this sorted out with the developer, but they've been pretty sporadic in responding and have not provided a solution. If I could get this issue taken care of, I'd probably jump to 5 stars...

Unfortunately as an IT System Admin I must rank 1 star Allowing users to bypass exchange rule enforcement is an extremely large security risk. While the app itself is great, I have been forced to block it in our environment as the ability to do so breaks the contract signed by employees when they start. Many of them do not understand this and view it as protection against a remote wipe by our company (only used in terminations during which the ex employee refuses to remove the account with a staff member present). Government information is strictly safeguarded.

STILL no unread count on icon on S5 Edit: New update and still the same thing.  Mailwise addressed my other issues and they appear to have been resolved.  However, I still am getting no unread count on the app icon on my S5 even though the box is checked.  Works fine on my S4 mini though.

Simply the best, for Gmail. As others have said, this the best email app out there. Incredibly simple, intuitive, and beautifully designed, inbox truly does keep everything very well organized. Back again Left for a while,  lured by those glossy,  feature packed Apps but have returned to a more reliable and simplistic client. Has improved and added many features and so more than happy to be back home on this App.

Lots of options It's a highly configurable multi-account client, perhaps even succumbing to feature creep driven by the user forums. Automatic account setup seems extraordinarily robust, and I've found no problems in daily use. Well worth the modest price for upgrading.

CAN'T FORWARD/REPLY OR SEARCH (BASIC EMAIL FUNCTIONS) DESPITE BEING ONE OF THE BEST EMAIL CLIENTS Messages usually load fine for viewing but when replying to or forwarding a message, it will get stuck trying to load the message. If you let it sit, it will never load but sometimes if you cancel it and keep retrying, it will eventually load. This happens on my IMAP account even when I have a good, active data connection. Plus Search BLOWS!! ..it just simply does not work. I've had these problems ever since I first found & started using Aquamail (YEARS AGO!). It's time for a new email client.

5 BIG stars! AquaMail raised the bar so high to really set itself apart from all other email apps. I would give it 10 stars if I could. It is beyond customizable, supports multiple accounts, aliases, and so much more. Great customer support, extensive website with instructions and answers. Well worth the one-time pro purchase. Phenomenal job dev!! Thank you!!
To the point! Not too fancy, it skips some bells and whistles for sheer simplicity and efficiency. It helps organize all my email accounts into one straight forward app!

Best app available for email on Android platform Excellent application ;very well advanced over stock native Gmail app. A world away; packed with customizations and features - well worth upgrading (highly recommended) a great gift to yourself!Thanks to dev. Good work- I'm impressed! The application makes email fun! Get the pro, guaranteed you'll be happy - 1,000,000+ people can't be wrong even w/o upgrade.

I've tried most of the Android email clients. The default mail app is crap (no mass delete? What a joke). Stuck with K-9 for a few months but gave up waiting for UI improvements and I could never get notification badges to work properly (S6 Edge). Outlook isn't bad, but MS has alienated me recently with "you need a Microsoft account" for everything under the sun. No thanks.  Installed Aqua and then purchased the second day. I have no issues with dev's getting compensated for their work.If you cant afford $6.00 then use a free one.  Just a pet peeve here...Why oh WHY do people complain about paying for an app? Is someone holding a gun to your head and FORCING you to purchase it? Just move on man, nobody cares why you don't want to pay for it.  Aqua is very feature rich and has a pleasant UI which does not look dated and stuck in the 90's. Pretty much everything has customization.   I also REALLY like the font options, re: sizing, bold, underlining and so forth. Very similar to a Word toolbar, and it works even for setting a sig. You can also insert and re-size images very easily.  So all in all, a very solid email client.

Great features, fantastic support Recent support from dev is best I've ever experienced on Android. Incredible number of settings & features available in a somewhat complex, but well organized structure. If you're having problems with a specific function, there's probably a setting for that. The ui is, imho, elegantly implemented.  Dev is actively developing additional features, and as hinted, fixes stuff asap. Well worth Pro$. .. Please ditch the stupid FAB (floating action button).

I would have liked it but. .. This app would be awesome except for one thing. ..It will only allow you to add two accounts, any more and you have to pay to unlock it. Bugger that, there are plenty of email apps out there that are just as good and let you use more than two accounts for FREE. I just can't bring myself to pay for an email app, sorry dev. Nice effort but I wish I had have known the limitations before I installed and set it up. Now uninstalling.
Great app! Well done! It will be better if it has the function:    SET EMAILS TO LATER - Quickly mark emails to be handled later and set reminders so user do not miss them.

I was happy, then I realized the promo signature... :( to prominent for a "free version" app. the app though is fast, well designed and pretty clever. I preferred it over cloudmail, k9mail, gmail, bluemail amm. BUT I  also think 7 dollars is really expensive to remove the annoying promo signature.  Why you don't use in app ads?  cheers anyway.

One of the best. It's been over a year since I first tried this app so I thought about giving it another shot and it STILL can't see my custom folders in yahoo. Is that so hard to accomplish?! Edit: bug solved, now almost perfect app.

Now that AquaMail has threaded conversations, I'll never look at another email app again. I've tried at least 8 email apps on Android, and AquaMail has the following advantages (off the top of my head): - Fantastic vertical split-screen handling - Tons of customization - Ability to NOT stay on in the background listening for push (if, like me, you'd rather only check mail while the app is running) - Really clear and simple handling of multiple accounts (fewer steps to switch between accounts than other apps) - Great compose UI - Doesn't sync secondary folders unless you say so - Full screen option - Easy, obvious access to reply, reply all, fwd, etc in the message viewer - You watch messages arrive when checking mail, instead of waiting for the polling to end, then waiting for all the messages to render in bulk like some other apps - Complete control of font sizes in all views - and the list goes on. THIS IS THE ONE.

I have been using a smartphone for the last 7 years and in that time I have never reviewed an app. That in itself should speak volumes. I also had absolutely no reason to pay for this app/donate -- none. The free app has ads but I only saw them once and they were unobtrusive and default to banner and not interstitial. The app works so well that once it's configured to your liking, you don't even need to open it. There are no nag screens and no limitations (that I saw anyway).  Some people are calling the interface clumsy and I couldn't disagree more. There are a lot of settings sure but as someone that likes things to work in a very specific way, I wouldn't like the app if it were any different.   The stock Android music apps would constantly lose my place. Using this app's player podcasts now pick from where I left off every single time. It's so nice to not spend 7 minutes every car trip finding my place and hitting play.  The app is perfect. Please don't change a thing. If you must,  only rearrange what's there or add to it. Do not remove anything. I also appreciate the developer only asking for the bare minimum of permissions.  To the developer, great work and thank you.

I love this podcast app and listen to various podcasts with it several times a day, well worth it for this paid version. However over the last 10 days or so I've been having intermittent problems, podcasts just stop playing or what looked like one podcast playing is actually another and others getting corrupted. I do subscribe to a lot of podcasts though and there is a possibility of data corruption, either my fairly new micro sd card (not a fake one) or my phone, Moto G2 which is only a few months old.  Editing to add that it looks like the problem was with my phone (Moto G2 8gb) corruption memory cards as I've now been through two of them and need another new one. Without a memory card inserted there haven't been any more problems with garbled podcasts.  I am still having problems with playing podcasts stopping in the middle of playing and Podcast Addict quits but I also think that this is due to bad memory management on the Moto G2 as I also have it installed on my Nexus 7 v2 tablet and don't have any problems.  Sorry (to the developer) that I missed his reply asking for more details and only saw it when I came on here to update.

What a bummer.  I just purchased the Pro version of this software.  I got the paid version because of the good reviews and the hardware acceleration.  Then I find out it will not play any AC3 audio.  So NO Dolby 5.1, DTS,  DTSHD, EAC3 or MLP will work.  I got this program to play videos on an NVidia Shield Android TV (NSAT) device on a 4K UHD TV and 7.1 surround sound home theater AV receiver.  There are all sorts of instructions or how to make sound come out of a phone,.  But the Shield just upgraded to Android 6 (Marshmallow), and nothing seems to work on the NSAT.  So BUYER BEWARE.  I really feel that a flaw this serious, should either be addressed, or potential buyers be forewarned.  **NOTE** Even with the third party codec for AC3 sound, it still downmixes the audio to only 2 channels (stereo). **Note Two** After owning this for a few weeks, I am upgrading my review from one to two stars,  Mainly because the program's buffering algorithms are better than other video players I've tried.  If it handled 5.1 channel audio codecs, I'd be giving it 4 or 5 stars.  Just license the stuff and charge more for the program.

If your focus is automatic multi-360-panorama or orbit missions, then you're better off with Ultimate Flight App (and cheaper). If you like better UX and potentially future features (tracking), then you are better off with this one. 3 stars due to value for money.        In comparison to the Ultimate Flight App:     (+) Much more intuitive interface/UX with Litchi     (+) Setting-up waypoint missions across devices     (+/-) Tracking functionality could be nice in the future, but still very experimental     (-) Waypoint missions only allow horizontal panoramas, no 360, no custom panoramas (have to choose separate flight mode for that)     (-) Waypoint missions do not allow circle-orbits (have to choose separate flight mode for that)     (-) Sequence of waypoints cannot be changed once waypoint mission is setup (waypoints have to be deleted and inserted and setup again)           @Litchi developers: Following features would be great (actually more than the tracking mode, sorted by my prio): 1) Integrate 360+custom panorama waypoints in the mission mode 2) Integrate orbit mode into flight mission mode 3) Change sequence of waypoints

I've attempted multiple times to contact support with no reply.  If I could attach screen shots,  I surely would.  ***The reply posted Below was sent only after this review was posted.  They are blaming the decoder saying the s5 isn't strong enough.   Ironically the same decoder that other vr flight apps use without issue as it is inbeded in the sdk. ***

Best Phantom App for Android [TO CONNECT] You may need to clear defaults in dji app and only open app through the pop up dialogue when you connect device to controller.[TO CALIBRATE]  You have to calibrate using onboard lights since the app does not have a u/i for the calibration feature. [BATTERY FIX] use "Purify" by Kingroot or similar app to kill unwanted background processes. Litchi App with the Phantom 3 Std. - works brilliantly so far.  I've only used Waypoints and FPV and they've been successful. Using the Mission Hub on your PC to create your Missions, is amazing. I think that is the likely cause of most issues with this App. It just doesnt work properly if DJI Go is running in the background, which it does.  Great development team and forums. Regular updates with new features. Love it so far.

So far so good I've recently been putting this app through its paces. This is similar to the DJI app but more versatile. Orbits can be set and adjusted from a distance. Missions and waypoints can be created with the smart phone without being connected, then saved, and loaded when u get to the shooting location. One of the best features for the cost is the FVP. Bloody awesome! It's greatest strength is its complexity and versatility to control and access the video feeds via multiple devices and protocols, where competing products are severely limited in order to appeal to the less tech savvy user. The ability to stream directly to VLC puts this app miles ahead of the rest. Keep up the fantastic work!

This is almost perfect, very very powerful and a reminder of why I switched to Android in the first place.   The functionality on this is astounding.  I wasn't sure what to expect but this really is a pretty good CCTV / Webcam option.     There's a couple of very small issues and one or two things which could be improved but it's still one of the best examples of a very VERY functional app I've seen on Android in a long time.  Right now it's hooked up to mains power for me, recording video based on motion or audio detection, I can go to a web interface and grab the files, remotely delete them - etc.     Real good stuff, despite the tiniest of issues, I still think this is easily worth 5* and the money.   (note, I bought the paid version, despite the free one doing what I needed, this kind of code should be supported)

Wow, what a find! I'm using an old, almost discarded ICS phone as a surveillance camera using Pavel's IPCamAdapter and  WebcamXP Free to continuously record video in one of the rooms in my house. It took a bit of a bit-twiddling to get it all hooked up and working but does work brilliantly. Thanks for this fab program and breathing new life into my old phone!
every time I start the stream, i get a "license error forbidden" and the camera disconnects.  Same message on all my devices.  Not sure why this app doesn't work anymore.
Does what it is supposed to do and does it well. The shortcut can also be integrated into Tasker w/ the help of the AutoShortcut plugin to activate from just about anything/anywhere!

OPINION & SUGESTION (1) tested on galaxy tab 2 10", lenovo a2107 7", motorola admiral, moto droid x, stratosphere i405, samsung i200, allview a5 smiley, s3mini g730a (at&t), s3mini i8190n (uk) and works perfect (2) add this and i buy it: the option to "start recording on device boot" is very usefull for better surveillance.. another one, but less important: device reboot.. it's usefull to correct different glitches

The online interface needs two additional options. Turning off the app, and restarting it. The flash option randomly stops responding, and I often get just a black screen unless I manually restart the app. Tbh a way to start the server remotely without needing tasker would be neat too.

Yes it will stream video to the web via Ivideon (free account only allows 2 cameras) BUT, Iveideon requires Android 4.1 or better so minus 1 star here since the description here doesn't say that. Or you need to be a geek to do a lot of other tricks to get an older phone connected to stream. BUT, if everything is on the same WIFI connection, almost anything will work and "night vision" settings even make an otherwise poor low light camera see pretty good so if all you want is a local baby monitor it is excellent. Primary device Samsung SM-T815Y Secondary device Samsung GT-P6800 Additional devices Dell Streak Mini 5 and TMobile MyTouch Slide. I noticed some are complaining that the APP "disconnects" I don't think this is an APP issue, I think it is an internet service provider issue. My primary device is on AT&T. When I am where I have true 4G, it works great, If I don't have good service, it will drop or sometimes not connect.

Great job! Shut up and take my money. If you need to know how good this is just download the free version. It's absolutely brilliant, simple, feature rich & robust I've been using it for two weeks 24/7. I don't even need the pro features, I'm just buying it as a show of gratitude.

Very useful. Made my Nexus 5 an amazingly good webcam for macro and highly detailed up close capture with controls from the browser. Liked it so much I bought the Pro version.   Take your time to learn all the different things it can do. Can view the video stream on VLC and control from the browser. It will drain the battery very fast on the device so take that into consideration for remote devices that you need to have cordless. Adjust the caching down on the network stream to minimize lag to VLC in the VLC network controls.

This app is amazing! I highly recommend both the pro and lite version, they are truly an amazing complete set of rugged useful features. Huge thanks to the developer, made great use out of old androids. Also great to see another member of the RepRap community.
Very good Excellent although the little bug makes both Focus and Flash somehow share the same options. Ex. you 'can' set your flash mode to Macro or Infinite making it a nasty bug

Awesome app! Suggestion for the developer: Multiple User Access with restriction settings for non admin users would be super useful! Great way to re-purpose old phones into something useful instead of just throwing them in the garbage. On device recording is great. Battery in my old LG Optimus last over 5 hours with minimal options set. Love this app, very polished and tons of options/ flexibility. Hint: If you need a static IP it must be set in your Android wifi settings.
Needs native FTP upload Very polished but needs native FTP upload like most FTP cameras have. Having to purchase another app (tasker) to do this is not ideal.

Impressive I was impressed with the free version, even though it was a little quirky. Bought this anyway to support the developer. The Pro version is a million times better. No ads, shortcut to start the server, and the sliding camera controls via the web interface actually work now! (they did not in the free version, even on the same device). The pro version even uses less bandwidth - in the free version, it would take up my entire 5MBPS upload limit no matter what quality stream I selected. In the pro version, even higher quality streams use less bandwidth! My antique Nexus 7 gen 1 tablet runs this well for extended periods!  Great job, dev! Hope you keep up with updates!

Great app I am using this to repurpose an old phone as well as turn my daily driver into an ad hoc web camera. The pro version offers tons of options within Tasker. Responsive developer. I emailed a question and got an answer right away. Works great with tinycam monitor.
Works well and does what it is meant to do Worth the upgrade, in my opinion. Works like a charm and never have a problem with it.

In general this has been a great app doing what it claims.  However, I have 2 nagging problems:  1)  The camera kept stopping and return back to the config menu after running for a while.  2)  I use tinycam Monitor software, and it kept failing to connect to IP web cam every now & then.  Not sure which app is causing the disconnect.  Would have been 5 stars if I can solve these 2 problems
Are you able to refund if their is not enough space R u able 2 refund if there's not enough space
Superb I am a CCTV engineer and this app is one of my most frequently used tools.

Input issues Great on paper, except that cellphones' head tracking ability is far from perfect, and I can't get the thing to read inputs from a USB device. I use my OTG cable to connect my keyboard or gamepad, both of which work outside the video player (even to navigate the menus within the app!) But I can't use those things to actually reorient the video player when the head tracking inevitably drifts. Fix this and it's 5 stars.

Vr player pro. Love this app. But every time I return from settings the aspect ratio has turned into 4x3. The only way to get the proper ratio is to reenter open files and restart movie. A bit of a pain when you are trying to fine tune your screen.

Great! The head tracking with my SGS6 isn't as good as the head tracking with my One Plus 2 phone (It's perfect!) It's a good idea to test a phone with this app and Cardboard if you're into VR and want a good experience.

There didn't seem to be a slideshow facility for pictures in the free version so I got the paid version thinking it may be a paid only function but it doesn't seem to be able to do it either. It's pretty pointless only being able to view one picture and not scroll backwards and forwards (or have an automatic timed option) through the whole album/directory or am I missing something? I'm not begrudging paying  1.28 for it as I'll probably still use it for videos but needs more photo viewing slideshow functions (particularly the ability to advance/go backwards through photos with a Bluetooth controller).

Very good foundation Already very much usable VR video player. Some more features and polish and it's there. Edit: You should wrap subtitles inside the screen. Long subtitles just go off-screen for me when watching external subtitles at least. Embedded mp4 subtitles work very well.

Far from perfect. But its the best of the bunch imo Doesn't work since the latest update. Blank white screen as soon as I launch the app, on my S5. UPDATE: I'm loving the new features and UI since your most recent update, have changed my rating to 5*. Unfortunately I can't get my cardboard 2.0 to work well with my Samsung S5, but that's no fault of the app. Thanks for the reply and keep up the good work!

Since last major update last year it's no more possible to fine adjust display settings (position and size of the 2 views). Therefore unusable on Nexus 6 because of double vision issue! Can you developer get a Nexus 6 and test it out?!? If I remember right we paid for this app!
Neat app Works well with a vr headset I got for Christmas. Has some weird tracking issue though where the video continually pans to the right and I have to keep re-entering the video.
Input Bug Having the same issues reported by other users regarding external inputs. Fix it and it's 5 stars!

The videos play ok until I switch to cardboard mode. Then it starts stuttering. Any solution to that? Otherwise a great app, sadly this is a critical point for immersion! UPDATE: I'm using a Galaxy S6. I tried restarting the phone, and I can see some degradation after I load the second movie - but even the first is not as slick as the video player or homido player. I really hope you guys can fix this!
Good Good app but needs more screen adjustments and the "url" feature is good, but a direct youtube search would be great as the url feature is hit and miss if it will work or not.

Poor stuttery performance On my very capablleGalaxy Note 5, this app somehow still has trouble running  even a 1080p 180 degree VR video at a relatively high bit rate without immersion-breaking stuttering and low framerate. 2160p, 15000 or above bit rate runs even worse. I know it's  not my phone at fault because I've tried the same videos in another  VR video player app called "AAA VR Cinema Cardboard and that runs high res & bit rate videos perfectly. It's  too bad, because VR Player Pro has the best customization options.

For a few bucks, this quality player is a good steal. There was some hiccups with some releases, but overall it is at the pinnacle of performance in the VR league. Recommended for anyone who wants the real deal. I can't wait to see what's coming next ..everything happens so fast nowadays!

I thought the pro version of this app was great for my S5, a 5 star program easily. However I upgraded to the S7 Edge this weekend and now whenever I try to open files from my SD card it says "can not open file". They opened fine on the SD card when it was in my S7. Can anyone help? I'll upgrade to 5 stars when this is fixed but at the moment it's useless.

Love it. Virtual Reality never felt so good. Watching my stored videos in a unique way is a dream come true not to mention the ability to watch 3d videos and YouTube videos. I highly recommend this product to VR enthusiasts.

Not consumer-ready Wouldn't load the first video I tried, but also gave no error message--just silently ignored the command. I tried a stream from the author's own site, and that worked, but it never hides the control overlay or title bar, which interferes a bit with VR. Double-tap to calibrate wouldn't work with the magnet in cardboard 1.0, so I had to pull the phone out of cardboard frequently. It's mostly okay once it gets a vid going, but it's very unpolished.

Stuttering badly 3D video over LAN will stutter badly(pausing for a moment for every few seconds of play), making it unusable. SpherePlay does not have this issue. Please optimize this so that it can flawlessly play video over a network drive without stuttering. I am using note 5 with ES explorer to choose which file to play over LAN. Most of the vr files are on the network drive since they mobile has limited space.
Used to be better. Why do my settings reset to default every time I load a video? Very annoying. Video is also choppy. Taking refund. (Droid turbo)

Works well enough, loved it especially for its customization options (projections, FOV etc). This is also one of the few cardboard VR apps that can be used on the Samsung Galaxy Note 2 without drifting (well it still drifts, but it will "compensate" eventually unlike almost all other apps, where drift is ever constant).   However, there is a small trouble for controlling with bluetooth peripherals (keyboard, joypad etc). It would seem that most of the time, the app will ignore inputs from such devices (they worked in other apps and at the homescreen). And once in a while, it will suddenly start working as it's supposed to. I have no idea and can't find out how to reliably make the app recognize bluetooth device inputs (they worked great when it works, but most of the time it doesn't). So I will definitely give it 5 stars when this small issue is fixed.

Recent update broke some things. I loved this app, it worked brilliantly. It's unfortunate that after a recent update that some key functionalities have broken. Currently running on a Xperia Z5 premium. Was utilizing a ps4 controller via Bluetooth for controlling which no longer functions regardless of how I map the buttons. Also, was using the head shaking motion to recenter and recalibrate the screen, but now it works spotty at best, requiring a large amount of force to register. Please consider working on these issues in the near future

Needs improvement but gets the job done The app menu does not rotate in both directions. My problem with the HTC One m8 is I can only have my headphone jack to the left. So the apps menu is upside down when in use.

Latest version rubbish Option to put padding between viewports has gone. This is fairly annoying. Can't open files from SD card on either file browser (crashes in simple mode when trying to go to root folder to move to SD card, the other just won't open the files). Can only open files in external app but most settings change to defaults each time. Flickering problem seems to be fixed but tracking drifts now. A formerly brilliant app; it's really disappointing now. Crashes on Marshmallow a lot during play. Devs unresponsive.

Option to remember projection type!! Excellent app, almost - but how is the user supposed to tolerate viewing many media of same projection type (in my case spherical images) when the projection setting reverts to "Plane" each time a new file is loaded? An obvious fix, please just add a "remember setting" toggle beneath the projection options so the user only needs to specify this once, if need be. Then I can stop pulling my hair out :)

Awesome player. Must have This is a MUST have for gear vr users. Need to have cardboard for gear installed first. Smacks down the standard vr gallery for a six. Watch 3d sbs in correct aspect so 3d ratio or adjust it so it's not squashed. If you double tap main control button it re aligns screen where ever you look, so I can full lay down and watch a movie AWESOME. Two things I would like to see. Option for gear vr in head display. Also a big cinema size screen. Instructions need to be clearer to use.

No longer able to play high res videos After the marshmallow update I'm no longer able to play high res videos that I was able to play before. It says error reading media. I am able to play them using other video players though.

Used to love it 1st time I bought it i was in love it was amazing. Got a new s6 (same phone) and it seems the update version of this app has insane scaling or ratio problems. I can't seem to watch the same exact videos anymore

Inter lens distance wrong This doesn't seem to be implementing the interlens distance correctly as I'm getting double vision in everything.  Other vr apps work fine and I'm now using a free vr player that does the job better than this that I paid for.  Wish I could get my money back
Great set of features and amazing performance compared to other players, but some videos just give you an "error while loading media' Can't rate this higher because of this.
No DTS support. this player will not play audio for most of the movies because of this. haven't been able to use much because of this reason. i have the pro version and my phone is Sony Z2

Like other players, it is intended for video. It doesn't have a slide show option for still photographs. I don't understand why it doesn't have slide show capabilities. VR users will take still photos, both 360 and 180 degree varieties. This player should support them.   An even bigger problem is one pointed out by other reviewers, it does not remember your settings. Here is an example. I have a collection of 180 strereo still photographs (side-by-side). To view them I have to search for and select one (it won't play all the files in a directory). Then switch to stereo (3D), then switch to "Dome" projection. That's about five steps and requires that I take the phone out of the viewer. To see the next photo I have to repeat THE WHOLE PROCESS. So this viewer is useless for viewing still images.   Seriously guys, you didn't think of this? Didn't notice it is a problem?

Update caused drifting on gs3 After the update it runs smooth but theres a bad drifting issue. Ive tried to calibrate it many ways suggested and nothing has worked. Ive tried to use every sensor setting and still drifts.

Good enough! Options like remote (Bluetooth device) recentering or locking position would give you all 5*! Now I have to slide out and in the phone every time it loose its orientation - every few minutes...

No magnet support so it's a no go Well, it supports my Zeiss viewer now which is great and it has plenty of settings and it might be great but it's a total deal breaker that it doesn't respond to the magnet like all the other VR players I've tried do. I don't want to fire up my Moga controller every time I want to watch a video.

Best Ever Tried all VR Player and nothing compare to this. Use the compass+ accelerometer feature if you're using cheap smartphone. No other app has it! Some suggestion (for 5 star): More input button option like double tap button, triple tap, etc. Buffering adjustment for playing video on ftp/nas. Exit option on menu.

Broken after latest update. Please fix! This app was great but is basically useless to me in its current state.                                                             *Update: I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling but I am still unable to play files from a USB drive and my Bluetooth mini game pad still doesn't work aside from the back button. Is there a way to map the remote buttons so it will work again? It looks to be set correctly but doesn't work during playback.  Thanks!

Very nice software, could use some updates here and there (waiting for the big release you guys are promising ;) ) Also a version for the gearvr would be awesome, since it has way more powerful sensors. Keep up the good product!

This WAS the best VR media player. But it's worthless for 3D content now. Updates have crippled it.  You used to be able to adjust the horizontal and vertical offsets (a.k.a. the IPD) but that was removed with v2. With out that setting 3D content doesn't work on my Nexus 6 + Knox v2 cardboard.  I purchased this quite a while ago and had lots of use out of the previous version which is the only reason I've not asking for a refund.   I would say look at VRTV instead for 3D content.
Please, add the support of choosing the projection by default, it really pisses off when you have to choose it every time you need to open new video!

Best option to play VR no doubt. I'm using VR Player Pro on my Galaxy S5 device. Videos play amazingly well. I'm glad there's an option to reset the camera position. But it rarely drifts (something that happened often in the AAA VR Cinema). There's no lag. And it's played virtually every file I've put on it! EDIT: They've replied to my review and the VR Menu now works! The only thing I could suggest to make this any better is a seek function for the VR Menu like the one in the YouTube 360 app :)
Hard to control panel by voice or megnet Input no use, or fail function, otherwise it's good

Dude, I very rarly will give five stars.  But, I am a novice DJ and I love techno music.  I was going to go out and buy a expensive controler, and I still am when I can afford it and I become more skilled, but it is hard to control or really get into it with just a mouse.  And, I really didn't think this would work at all, BUT THIS IS THE TICKET.  I works flawlessly and I feel like I am actually playing an instrument or something. Now a great app! I started having problem with the app having corrupted video most of the time. Contacted the support team,  which is very great! Should have waited with Android release.  There are just too many issues for this app to be considered stable and too many features missing "while we are working on them." There's also a problem with excessive contrast that can't be adjusted. Sure, you can underexpose and hope to restore detail in darker areas in post production. But for a "state-of-the-arts" app, that's unacceptable. I recognise that creating a sophisticated app that works equally well on many Android phones is a much taller order than it is for the few iPhone variants. But that's precisely why they should have waited or at least waited to charge for an unfinished product. Bad sport!!

The Android version of this app still needs a lot of love. I'm using it on my Samsung S7 and there are several features that either don't work or are broken in some fashion or another. A few cases in point, I cannot control the mic audio gain at all. The slider moves up and down properly, but doesn't affect the audio feed whatsoever. Another is the focus lock. I can move the slider which will temporarily move the camera focus to that point, but then the camera immediately attempts to auto focus on something else within the frame. Even without the use of the slider, setting the app to lock the focus does nothing. The camera focus on whatever it feels is the main subject. Exposure is also somewhat broken. While I can manually set exposure and it does stay locked, moving the exposure reticle to different parts of the view does absolutely nothing. It's always using a weighted balance over the entire image. So, i have to full frame a section that has the correct exposure, then lock that level, and finally pull back to the scene I want to capture. There are more problems, but I'm out of words for one review.  If they can mirror the iPhone app (which I also have) 5 stars. For now only 3.

Poorly thought out but great start Although this is a very powerful video recording app, it is implemented in a way that is illogical for Android users.  One example is the "remove" button in the clips browser. Why couldn't you just use the word "delete"? The developers should remember that these are not Apple users using FilMic on Android, these are Android users who may never have seen your Apple app! Another example is scrolling through the menus. It is completely illogical for an Android user. With all that said it is a very powerful video recording app. My favorite feature is the ability to set the file names by project, and have them incrementaly updated as I create new takes. So from an engineering perspective it's a magnificent app, but please hang the Apple GUI designer from a tree, and get someone more used to developing GUI on Android!

The android version of this App does NOT have the same framerates and resolutions as the iOs version.  The app is fine, but the big selling point was customization.  I wanted to use this app for specific framerates and slow/fast motion effects that I cannot choose because they aren't on the limited preset list.  Including anything above 30fps at any resolution.  There are also no resolutions between 2k and 4k which I would have liked to used for stabilization and/or downscaling in post.  (also annoying that all the cool aspect ratios like cinemascope are crops from 1080p only, a minor quibble since there are guides).  There's nothing "wrong" with this app so much as it is clearly using its success on ios to sell itself while not making it clear (Except in fine print) the android version does not have the same capabilities leading to disappointment.
It's OK The app seems OK but I can't even save preset video settings, not sure why, I've tried 3 times with no success.

I have an idea! ok, I've been thinking of some awesome options for the unlocker, for example, if you can add sound to the animation, and for each time you play the animation you hear the sound at the same time. it would be perfect so the video and sound sync, so it is easier for smoother animating and also so you don't mess up, next would be a blur tool, for special opacity, which would be great for people who want frames that create a nice fade in or fade out (or just to add a nice shade to their creation), more layers (10 at least),and a option where you can merge the layers you pick, also it would be great if you can change layers (example: 1st layer moves over 2nd so the layer originally on top is covered) lastly, an option where you can include images for some frames/layers, that would be so amazing! ^-^  (Sorry if I sound a bit selfish, but these are just some things that I've thought about to make the app even better! :3)

I had problems at first using this with my quanum v2 goggles. I bought the right easycap device off ebay, and had to buy a male to male rca cable as well. I kept getting "signal lost" every time I plugged my phone in. This is for two reasons. First, turn off the signal detection. Second, I had to change the settings: Startup device to UTV007 (iSTK1160 was the default), and video format to NTSC (PAL was default).   Other thoughts: Since it's the only app I've found that actually recognizes that a camera is plugged in, I suppose the price is worth it. There is some latency. It's to be expected though. Not too bad, you can probably use this as your main monitor if you wanted to be super cheap.  It would be nice if this could record, but there are screen recording apps that can be downloaded.   I hope this helps if you're having trouble setting it up.

Newer review from 2016 (5 stars): MX Player looks, works, and performs significantly better than the other half a dozen similar apps on my phone. My backup video player is currently VLC, which is a decent player but does not come close to MX Player. That said, there is a feature in VLC that I would really like MX Player to have: Sleep timer. If this feature is added, I'll be happy to support the developers further by purchasing the Pro version.  Original review from 2014 (4 stars): I have a love-hate relationship with MX Player. It looks, works, and performs significantly better than the other half a dozen similar apps on my phone - yes, I do have 6 other players installed - but it comes up short in regards to playing certain video files. It is a pity - and it is often quite frustrating - that there is such a glaring issue, as I'd much rather use MX Player exclusively. For now, my main backup player is BSPlayer, which plays almost video file that I throw at it.

Awesome, but... I love the app, I think it's really easy to use, and the options you have are helpful. However, I'd like it if I could rearrange my uploads the way I want them, in MY order, not by most recent, author or anything else. The Night reading mode is  bit overzealous -- the screen is bright orange at night! More generally:  Play Books is pretty nice. It's great to have a consistent x-platform experience.  But why doesn't Google take advantage of owning both Google Drive and Play Books? If I have a book in GD, and upload it to PB, I now have two copies. Each has their own separate annotations and bookmarks, not to mention taking up twice the storage.   This is particularly frustrating with books on the laptop. Here I have 2 reading options: Play Books's web app VS a real ebook reader sourcing the files from my Google Drive folder. Obviously I'll use the latter (SSD+SATA access speed vs web!). So now my annotations and bookmarks are out of sync between mobile and macbook.  Furthermore, none of the clients (iOS, Android, web) allow copying text, even with unrestricted PDFs. This is a bit nuts given this is one of only 3 advantages that electronic text has over the real thing (search, portability, copy/paste). How many people read non-fiction without copying sections for notes or review?

Now my favorite e-reader app\U0001f496 Great clean design and is the best looking e-reader out there. Ability to make notes and view them as popups is one of my favorite features. I love the convenience of the widgets and how beautifully designed they are. Great app.  Less great policies. Storing notes and highlights on GDocs is an excellent idea.  It's easy to skim quickly through a book to find a section of interest or to get back to a section after a jump forward or back. Unfortunately G's policy on number of devices per book is very annoying.  There is a maximum of three devices per book, which seems a little tight but acceptable.  Except that it is very awkward to release a book from a device that isn't actually in your hand.  Your phone is suddenly defunct? Your tablet is at home?  Or you have more than three devices?  Yore out of luck, and can't download the book to your device in hand.
